Ajit Vadakayil</a></cite><span class=\"icon user blog-author\" style=\"background-image: url(&quot;data:image/png; background-repeat: no-repeat; display: inline-block; font-weight: bold; height: 18px; margin: 0px 0px -4px 6px; width: 18px;\"></span><span class=\"datetime secondary-text\" style=\"margin-left: 6px;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2015/12/thermal-coal-power-plants-clean-exhaust_9.html?showComment=1449647049845#c1628069338233665589\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration: none;\">December 9, 2015 at 1:14 PM</a></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" id=\"bc_0_6MC\" style=\"margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\nhi vk,<br />\n<br />\nthis is like AMWAY points.<br />\n<br />\nJEWS always will make the moolah-- everbody else loses.<br />\n<br />\nit is a WIN-LOSE system.<br />\n<br />\nhttp://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2013/03/amway-merchants-of-pipe-dreams-capt.html<br />\n<br />\nA carbon credit (often called a carbon offset) is a KOSHER financial instrument ( which made Al Gore a CARBON BILLIONAIRE ) that represents a tonne of CO2 (carbon dioxide) or CO2e (carbon dioxide equivalent gases) removed or reduced from the atmosphere from an emission reduction project, which can be used, by governments, industry or private individuals to offset damaging carbon emissions that they are generating.<br />\n<br />\nCarbon credits are associated with either removing existing CO2 or CO2e emissions from the atmosphere in the case of carbon sequestration from forests and planting of trees or the reduction of future CO2 or CO2e emissions from renewable energy and energy efficiency projects that displace fossil fuel power generation production or industrial processes.<br />\n<br />\nCarbon credits originate from a range of emission reduction activities associated with the removal of existing emissions from the atmosphere and the reduction of future emissions. These are commonly called KOSHER \"methodologies\".<br />\n<br />\nAfforestation and reforestation activities are a key means by which existing emissions can be removed from the atmosphere and carbon credits created while construction of a USELESS UNSTEADY KOSHER wind farm rather than a EFFICIENT WORKHORSE coal-fired power station may create carbon credits through reducing future emissions.<br />\n<br />\nBRRAAAAAAYYYYYYYYYYYYYYY !<br />\n<br />\ncapt ajit vadakayil<br />\n..</div>\n</div>\n</li>\n</span></ol>\n<span id=\"bc_0_7b+seedLzY5D\" kind=\"d\">\n</span></div>\n<span id=\"bc_0_7b+seedLzY5D\" kind=\"d\">\n</span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; CHINA HAS SMOG INDIA HAS SMOG/ FLOODS<br />\n<br />\nANT IDIOT CAN CREATE AN INVERSION ON TOP OF A CITY AND CREATE SMOG<br />\n<br />\nLORD KRISHNA WAS THE FIRST TO CRATE AN INVERSION ON THE 13TH DAY OF MAHABHARATA WAR 6000 YEARS AGO, USING HIS SUDARSHAN CHAKRA --ON SCALAR INTERFEROMETRY ENDOTHERMIC MODE ( TO CREATE TEMPORARY DARKNESS BY SUN DIPPING BELOW HORIZON )<br />\n<br />\nSMOG FUNDA :<br />\n<br />\nEmissions from petrol cars have been dramatically reduced by the introduction of catalytic converters, which oxidise pollutants such as CO to less harmful gases such as CO2. When compared to petrol cars without catalysts, catalyst cars have much lower CO, HC and NOx emissions, at the expense of CO2 emissions, which increase due to the oxidation of carbon monoxide to CO2.<br />\n<br />\nAs a consequence of this, a catalyst car will also use slightly more fuel and become less efficient.<br />\n<br />\nPetrol cars with catalysts still produce more CO and HC than diesel cars, although exhaust emissions of NOx and particulates are much lower than diesel cars. In fact particulate emissions from petrol cars are so low that they are not routinely measured.<br />\n<br />\nWhen compared to petrol cars with a catalyst, diesels have higher emissions of NOx and much higher emissions of particulate matter.<br />\n<br />\nConsequently, diesel cars produce less unburned fuel during a cold start,( than a petrol car ) which will result in lower emissions of carbon monoxide and hydrocarbons.<br />\n<br />\nDiesel cars emit less hydrocarbons, carbon monoxide and lead pollution than petrol cars, but produce more noxious gases and significantly more particulates.<br />\n<br />\nEmissions of CO from CNG powered vehicles are of the same order as those emitted by diesel vehicles. However, emissions of total hydrocarbons (THC) from CNG vehicles are relatively high because of methane, the major component of natural gas.<br />\nAlthough methane is a small contributor to the formation of low level ozone it is a major factor in global warming. Emissions of NOx and particulates from both LPG and CNG powered vehicles are significantly lower than those from diesel vehicles.<br />\nMoreover, emissions of NOx from CNG vehicles are half those from equivalent petrol engined vehicles.<br />\n<br />\nCNG VEHICLES EXHAUSTS CONTAIN NANO CARBON WHICH BREACH THE BLOOD BRAIN BARRIER AND CAUSES CANCER/ TB / LUNG PROBLEMS . WOOD FIRE SMOKE TO MAKE A CHAPPATI DOES NOT BREACH THE BLOOD BRAIN BARRIER .. NANO CARBON FROM CNG EXHAUSTS CAUSES SMOG . .<br />\n<br />\nBurning natural gas DOES produce nitrogen oxides (NOx), which are precursors to smog, but at lower levels than gasoline and diesel used for motor vehicles.<br />\n<br />\n<br />\nCompressed natural gas (CNG) (methane stored at high pressure) c CNG is made by compressing natural gas (which is mainly composed of methane, CH4), to less than 1 percent of the volume it occupies at standard atmospheric pressure. It is stored and distributed in hard containers at a pressure of 20\u201325 MPa (2,900\u20133,600 psi), usually in cylindrical or spherical shapes.<br />\n<br />\nHUMPLESS COWS FART METHANE THE WHOLE DAY ..IF HUMPLESS COWS ARE EXTERMINATED METHANE EMISSIONS WILL REDUCE .<br />\n<br />\nMETHANE IS A POTENT GREENHOUSE GAS-21 TIMES MORE POTENT THAN CO2 .<br />\n<br />\nWITHOUT CO2 THERE CAN BE NO LIFE ON EARTH.<br />\n<br />\ncapt ajit vadakayil<br />\n..</div>\n<b><span style=\"color: red;\"><br /></span></b>\n<span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\"><b><span style=\"color: blue;\">ALL SMALL NATIONS AT COP21 PARIS ARE TERRIFIED OF OPPOSING BIG BROTHERs DEMAND - EVEN THOUGH THEY DO NOT UNDERSTAND THE </span><span style=\"color: red;\">EVIL CARBON CREDIT SYSTEM</span><span style=\"color: blue;\"> AT ALL&nbsp;</span></b></span><br />\n<span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\"><b><br /></b></span>\n<span style=\"color: red;\"><span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\"><b>IF THEY DO NOT SIGN ON THE DOTTED LINE , THERE WILL BE ZIONIST JEW SPONSORED REGIME CHANGE SOONER THAN LATER &nbsp;. </b></span><b style=\"color: red;\">.</b></span><br />\n<b><span style=\"color: red;\"><br /></span></b>\n<br />\n<div class=\"comment-header\" id=\"bc_0_41M\" kind=\"m\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; line-height: 22.4px; margin: 0px 0px 8px;\">\n<cite class=\"user blog-author\" style=\"font-style: normal; font-weight: bold;\"><a href=\"https://www.blogger.com/profile/14410812789424637654\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration: none;\">Capt. font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Emissions trading, or\ncap-and-trade schemes, which allow companies to buy or sell \u201ccredits\u201d that\ncollectively bind all participating companies to an overall emissions limit.\nWhile markets operate for specific pollutants such as greenhouse gases and acid\nrain, by far the biggest emissions market is for carbon.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; line-height: 22.4px; margin-left: 48px; position: relative;\">\n<div class=\"comment-header\" id=\"bc_0_90M\" kind=\"m\" style=\"margin: 0px 0px 8px;\">\n<cite class=\"user\" style=\"font-style: normal; font-weight: bold;\"><a href=\"https://www.blogger.com/profile/04177296018307800610\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration: none;\">Rn Murthy</a></cite><span class=\"icon user\" style=\"font-weight: bold;\"></span><span class=\"datetime secondary-text\" style=\"margin-left: 6px;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2015/12/thermal-coal-power-plants-clean-exhaust_9.html?showComment=1449762376039#c6141742467828602192\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration: none;\">December 10, 2015 at 9:16 PM</a></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" id=\"bc_0_90MC\" style=\"margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\nDear Capt Ajit sir,<br />\n<br />\nYour water computer prophecy has come true...read this : https://www.facebook.com/colorsofindiaindia/photos/a.306211862794064.73975.306200486128535/937940272954550/?type=3&amp;theater<br />\n<br />\nManu Prakash, an Indian-American scientist, has created a computer that runs on water. Prakash, Assistant Professor of Bio-engineering at Stanford, teamed up with two of his students, Jim Cybulski and Georgios Katsikis, to design a unique computer that works on the Physics of moving water droplets.<br />\nHere are 8 things you need to about Prakash and his amazing technology \u2013<br />\n1. The computer uses water instead of electrons to send the data.<br />\n2. The team designed arrays of tiny iron bars on glass slides that look something like a Pac-Man maze. They laid a blank glass slide on top and sandwiched a layer of oil in between.<br />\n3. This was followed by carefully injecting the individual water droplets that had been infused with tiny magnetic nano-particles.<br />\n4. The tiny water droplets are trapped in a magnetic field. The droplets move in a precise direction and distance when the magnetic field is rotated. This results in a computer clock which is a crucial component in a device like a computer.<br />\n5. The clock is responsible for various operations to start and stop resulting in information synchronisation.<br />\n6. The invention would turn the computer into a high-throughput chemistry and biology laboratory which is the immediate application of this invention. The droplets will work as test tubes and carry the chemicals.<br />\n7. Computer clocks are responsible for nearly every modern technology including smartphones, DVRs, airplanes, internet, etc.<br />\n8. Prakash got the idea of building a computer like this 10 years ago while he was graduating from Massachusetts Institute of Technology<br />\n<br />\nContent via : TheBetterIndia</div>\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"comment-replies\" id=\"bc_0_90BR\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">You see--coal. plants\nwill&nbsp; only&nbsp; be allowed release the amount of SO2 equal to\nthe allowances they have been issued. Allowances\nare traded and sold nationwide.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">All power plants\ncovered by the Kosher Acid Rain Program have to install continuous emission\nmonitoring systems, and instruments that keep track of how much SO2 and NOx the\nplant's individual units are releasing. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Big Brother\u2019s agents\nwill decide whether you will get positive/ negative CARBON CREDIT<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">BIG BROTHER WILL\nCONTROL EVERYBODYs FORTUNES<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">MAJJA HAI !<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<b><span style=\"color: red;\"><br /></span></b>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The environmental\nbenefits of gasification &nbsp;(integrated\ngasification combined cycle-IGCC)\u2014stem from the capability to achieve extremely\nlow SOx, NOx and particulate emissions from burning coal-derived gases.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Sulfur dioxide (SO2)\nand nitrogen oxides (NOx) are the principal pollutants that cause acid\nprecipitation. SO2 and NOx emissions released to the air react with water vapor\nand other chemicals to form acids that fall back to Earth. About 40 percent of\nNOx emissions are from power plants.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Acid precipitation is\nproduced when certain types of air pollutants mix with the moisture in the air\nto form an acid. These acids then fall to Earth as rain, snow, or fog.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Heavy rainstorms and\nmelting snow can cause temporary increases in acidity in lakes and streams.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The air pollutants that\ncause acid rain can do more than damage the environment-they can damage our\nhealth.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">High levels of SO2 in the air aggravate various lung problems in people\nwith asthma and can cause breathing difficulties in children and the elderly.\nIn some instances, breathing high levels of SO2 can even damage lung tissue.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Since the wind can\ncarry pollutants across the country, the effects of acid rain can be seen far\nfrom the original source of the acid forming pollutant.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The pollutants that\ncause acid rain can make the air hazy or foggy; acid rain can damage manmade\nobjects such as stone statues, buildings, and monuments. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Coal-based IGCC plant\ncan use upto 30% biomass and garbage as a supplemental feedstock.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Coal gasification will\nbe at the heart of future generations of clean coal technology plants.&nbsp; Current IGCC technology does NOT work\nwell&nbsp; more than 100m above sea level. The\nmain problem for IGCC is its high capital cost.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Gasifiers have failed\ndue to furnace refractory liner problems, and those problems were expensive to\nrepair. This is because direct flame impingement areas on refractory needs to\nbe protected by a waterwall.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Gasification avoids\nburning coal altogether. With integrated gasification combined cycle (IGCC)\nsystems, steam and hot pressurized air or oxygen combine with coal in a\nreaction that forces carbon molecules apart.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The resulting syngas, a mixture of\ncarbon monoxide and hydrogen, is then cleaned and burned in a gas turbine to\nmake electricity. The heat energy from the gas turbine also powers a steam\nturbine. Since IGCC power plants create two forms of energy, they have the\npotential to reach a fuel efficiency of 50 percent<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">An integrated\ngasification combined cycle (IGCC) is a technology that uses a high pressure\ngasifier to turn coal and other carbon based fuels into pressurized\ngas\u2014synthesis gas (syngas). It can then remove impurities from the syngas prior\nto the power generation cycle.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Some of these pollutants, such as sulfur, can be\nturned into re-usable byproducts. This results in lower emissions of sulfur\ndioxide, particulates, mercury, and in some cases carbon dioxide. With\nadditional process equipment, a water-gas shift reaction can increase gasification\nefficiency and reduce carbon monoxide emissions by converting it to carbon\ndioxide.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The resulting carbon dioxide from the shift reaction can be separated,\ncompressed, and stored through sequestration. Excess heat from the primary\ncombustion and syngas fired generation is then passed to a steam cycle, similar\nto a combined cycle gas turbine.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This process results in improved thermodynamic\nefficiency compared to conventional pulverized coal.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Rather than burning\ncoal directly, gasification (a thermo-chemical process) breaks down coal - or\nvirtually any carbon-based feedstock - into its basic chemical constituents.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In\na modern gasifier, coal is typically exposed to steam and carefully controlled\namounts of air or oxygen under high temperatures and pressures. Under these\nconditions, molecules in coal break apart, initiating chemical reactions that\ntypically produce a mixture of carbon monoxide, hydrogen and other gaseous\ncompounds.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Gasification, in fact,\nmay be one of the most flexible technologies to produce clean-burning hydrogen\nfor tomorrow's automobiles and power-generating fuel cells. Hydrogen and other\ncoal gases can also be used to fuel power-generating turbines, or as the\nchemical \"building blocks\" for a wide range of commercial products. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">An IGCC plant improves\nthe overall process efficiency by adding the higher-temperature steam produced\nby the gasification process to the steam turbine cycle. This steam is then used\nin steam turbines to produce additional electrical power<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">There is a much lower\nlevel of ash produced in the gasifier, which reduces cleanup and downtime in\nits gas cooling and cleaning stages.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The main feature is\nthat instead of using oxygen and nitrogen to gasify coal, they use oxygen and\nCO2. The main advantage is that it is possible to improve the performance of\ncold gas efficiency and to reduce the unburned carbon<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">One of the most\nefficient ways to treat the H2S gas from an IGCC plant is by converting it into\nsulphuric acid .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Sulfur in coal, for\nexample, is converted to hydrogen sulfide and can be captured by processes\npresently used in the chemical industry. &nbsp;In some methods, the sulfur can be extracted\nin either a liquid or solid form that can be sold commercially. &nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In the&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Integrated Gasification Combined-Cycle (IGCC)\nplant, the syngas produced is virtually free of fuel-bound nitrogen.</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp; </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">NOx from the gas turbine is limited to\nthermal NOx. Diluting the syngas allows for NOx emissions as low as 15 parts\nper million</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">If oxygen is used in a\ncoal gasifier instead of air, carbon dioxide is emitted as a concentrated gas\nstream in syngas at high pressure. In this form, it can be captured and\nsequestered more easily and at lower costs.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">By contrast, when coal burns or is\nreacted in air, 79 percent of which is nitrogen, the resulting carbon dioxide is\ndiluted and more costly to separate<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">CO2 IS NOT A PROBLEM . &nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">WE IN INDIA LOVE CO2<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<b><span style=\"color: red;\"><br /></span></b>\n<b><span style=\"color: red;\"><br /></span></b>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u201cW\u201d flame boiler\nburning lean coal with a high combustion temperature and high excessive air ratio\ncreates the highest NOx emission among the tested boilers. The boiler burning\nbituminous coal with&nbsp; high volatile\ncontent gives the lowest NOx emission.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">NOx plays a very important role and is blamed for ozonosphere&nbsp; destruction, acid rain and respiratory\nproblems&nbsp; to mankind. Normally, one ton\nof coal burnt could produce 8 ~ 9 kg NOx .NOx emission&nbsp; from power plants must be less than 450mg/Nm3.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Compared with boilers burning bituminous coal, boilers burning anthracite and\nlean coals have higher NOx emission and lower boiler efficiency.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Boiler mode and coal\ntype have big impacts&nbsp; on boiler\nperformance and NOx emission. Normally, boilers burning higher volatile coal\nproduce less NOx. . Coal with high volatile has better ignition behavior, which\ncan tolerate lower furnace temperature, hence inhibit the generation of both\nfuel NOx and thermal NOx.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Coal with high volatile can burn out easily, and can\nalso allow a low excess air ratio, which restrains the conversion of fuel\nnitrogen to NOx.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">For the W-flame boiler,\nthe wall at the low section of&nbsp; furnace\nis covered by refractory to form a thermal insulation layer. The combustion\ntemperature there could reach up to 1500 </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria math&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u2103</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">\nor even higher, which is close to the theoretical combustion temperature. The\nhigh temperature could be beneficial to stabilize the combustion of anthracite\nand lean coals.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A high boiler efficiency could be earned with\nhigh furnace temperature and high excessive air ratio but also high NOx\nemission up to 1500mg/m3 . &nbsp;W-flame boiler due to high combustion temperature, thermal\nNOx can also be considerably produced by reason of the typical features of\nW-flame boiler: high furnace temperature, oxygen-enriched combustion, high thermal\nload and long combustion time in high temperature area, etc.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">As a result,\nW-flame boiler has the highest NOx emission. High efficiency and low NOx emissions\nof these boilers can be attributable to the high volatile coal used in the\nboilers.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Smog is increased by inversion that traps pollution close to the\nground. It is usually highly toxic to humans and can cause severe sickness or\nshortened life . Ground-level ozone, sulfur dioxide, nitrogen dioxide and\ncarbon monoxide are especially harmful for senior citizens, children, and\npeople with heart and lung conditions such as emphysema, bronchitis, and asthma.\n.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Bituminous coal with high volatile does not need much oxygen (concentration\nfrom 2.85% to 4.9%) compared to 6% for blended coal, anthracite and lean coal. .\nFor most boilers, NOx emissions rise with the increase of excess air ratio at\nfurnace outlet&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This proves that the influences of coal type and oxygen\nconcentration on NOx emission are interdependent. High volatile coal presents\ngood ignition behavior, it demands low oxygen concentration and low furnace\ntemperature which inhibit the formations of fuel NOx and thermal NOx, thus\ngenerates low NOx .</span> <span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Due to the demands for temperature and\noxygen concentration in furnaces, different coal types lead to different boiler\nefficiencies and NOx emissions.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A coal plant which uses the coaxial fire\nsystem, has less NOx emission( 140mg/Nm3) while a W-flame boiler will have a\nmuch higher NOx emission although both boilers utilize the same fuel.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Advanced swirl-flow\nburners</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;ms gothic&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\uff08</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">dual adjusting\nswirl-flow burner ) and HT-NR3 swirl-flow burner can achieve staged combustion at\nthe flow axial direction and avoid the formation of high temperature and oxygen\nrich zone, and consequently reduce the NOx emissions</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The principle of new dual adjusting\nswirl-flow burner is to introduce combustion air into the coal powder flow\ngradually and control the mixing process of the coal with air rationally in\nburner area to inhibit generation of NOx and keep high boiler efficiency&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Normally,\na high furnace temperature would lead to a high NOx emission, &nbsp;There are 24 low NOx swirl-flow burners\n(HT-NR3) arranged into 3 layers in the front wall and the back wall of the\nboiler respectively. 10 AAP nozzles are arranged on the top of the burner.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The\nHT-RN3 burners can improve the ignitability and the flame stability of high\nconcentrated powder. These burners delay the mixture of the primary air and the\nsecondary air and achieve the staged air supply. This creates fuel enrich and\nhigh &nbsp;emperature zones at the exit of the\nburners, and reduce the NOx emissions, and enhance the low load combustion\nstability without using extra oil.</span>&nbsp;</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">These plants have a\nhigh efficiency of 95 %, and the lowest NOx emission of 326mg/Nm3&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">NOx emission\nand boiler efficiency can be improved by reasonably adjusting the boiler\noperational parameters. The parameters which can influence NOx emission mainly\ninclude: primary air velocity, powder concentration, powder granularity,\nauxiliary air distribution, powder distribution at each layers in furnaces,\nexcessive air ratio, boiler load, etc&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The amount of total air entering the\nboiler has an influence on the quantity of flue gas, the burnout of coal, etc.\nNOx emission and the boiler efficiency have been studied by changing the oxygen\nconcentration at the outlet of the economizer of the boiler&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Increase of air\nleads to the temperature in combustion area going up, which enhances generation\nof NOx.</span> <span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When\nusing lean coal, the oxygen concentration should be kept at around 4.25% to\nreduce the combustible content in fly ash.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When using bituminous coal, the\noxygen concentration should be kept at around 3.2%. The experiment shows that\nthe boiler efficiency could be maintained at 94% for both cases, while NOx\nemission could be kept at a low level, less than 400mg/m3.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A high boiler load\nresults in a high furnace temperature which can enhance NOx generation.\nMeanwhile, a high load is also beneficial to coal powder combustion and improve\nthe boiler efficiency.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Boiler\nperformance and NOx emission are greatly influenced by the boiler &nbsp;configuration and the burner type, as well as\nthe coal type.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"color: blue; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: large; line-height: 150%;\"><b>MR MODI-- &nbsp;DO NOT BITE OFF MORE INDC THAN YOU CAN CHEW OR EVEN FIT INTO YOUR MOUTH .&nbsp;</b></span><br />\n<span style=\"color: blue; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: large; line-height: 150%;\"><b><br /></b></span>\n<span style=\"color: blue; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: large; line-height: 150%;\"><b><span style=\"color: red;\">NATIONAL SOVREIGNITY</span><span style=\"color: blue;\"> MUST NOT BE MERELY \"</span><span style=\"color: magenta;\">RESPECTED</span><span style=\"color: blue;\">\" BUT \"</span><span style=\"color: red;\">GUARANTEED</span><span style=\"color: blue;\">\"-- &nbsp; THIS IS THE ONLY WAY WHEN YOU DEAL WILL KOSHER AGREEMENTS &nbsp;.</span></b></span><br />\n<span style=\"color: blue; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: large; line-height: 150%;\"><b><br /></b></span>\n<span style=\"color: blue; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: large; line-height: 150%;\"></span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><a href=\"http://www4.unfccc.int/submissions/INDC/Published%20Documents/India/1/INDIA%20INDC%20TO%20UNFCCC.pdf\">http://www4.unfccc.int/submissions/INDC/Published%20Documents/India/1/INDIA%20INDC%20TO%20UNFCCC.pdf</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<span style=\"color: blue; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: large; line-height: 150%;\"><b><br /></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/7F5K1BN6iN8/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/7F5K1BN6iN8?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b style=\"background-color: yellow;\">BELOW: &nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;</b></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b style=\"background-color: yellow;\"><br /></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<span style=\"font-size: medium;\"><b style=\"background-color: yellow;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\">FOODLESS TREE COVER , LIKE THE FAALTHU WAY SAGDURU JAGGI VASUDEV &nbsp;DID IN TAMILNADU ARBITRARILY ( </span>TO GET INTO GUINESS BOOK OF WORLD RECORDS AND GIVE COMPETITION TO TRIPLE SRI <span style=\"font-size: large;\">) , &nbsp;WILL KILL BHARATMATA. &nbsp;&nbsp;</span></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b style=\"background-color: yellow;\"><br /></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b style=\"background-color: yellow;\">UNDERSTAND THE DYNAMICS OF GROUND WATER TABLE HYDRAULICS ! &nbsp; - &nbsp;</b></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b style=\"background-color: yellow;\"><br /></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<span style=\"color: red; font-size: x-large;\"><b style=\"background-color: yellow;\">BE WARNED ! !&nbsp;</b></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b style=\"background-color: yellow;\"><br /></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b style=\"background-color: yellow;\">FOOD &nbsp;/ FUEL SUGAR CANE CULTIVATION BY SUGAR BARONS (LOWERING WATER TABLE ) HAVE CAUSED THOUSANDS OF FARMERS TO COMMIT SUICIDE.&nbsp;</b></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/qi18D9f_Puw/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/qi18D9f_Puw?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<b><span style=\"color: red;\"><br /></span></b>\n<b><span style=\"color: red;\"><br /></span></b>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In a typical coal\ncombustion-based power plant, heat from burning coal is used to boil water,\nmaking steam that drives a steam turbine-generator. In some coal\ncombustion-based power plants, only a third of the energy value of coal is\nactually converted into electricity.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A coal gasification\npower plant, however, typically gets dual duty from the gases it produces.\nFirst, the coal gases, cleaned of impurities, are fired in a gas turbine - much\nlike natural gas - to generate one source of electricity.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The hot exhaust of\nthe gas turbine, and some of the heat generated in the gasification process,\nare then used to generate steam for use in a steam turbine-generator. This dual\nsource of electric power, called a \"combined cycle,\" is much more\nefficient in converting coal's energy into usable electricity.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The fuel\nefficiency of a coal gasification power plant in this type of combined cycle\ncan potentially be boosted to 50 percent or more.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Like I said, IGCC uses\na coal gasification system to convert coal into a synthesis gas (syngas) and\nproduce steam. The hot syngas is processed to remove sulfur compounds, mercury\nand particulate matter before it is used to fuel a combustion turbine\ngenerator, which produces electricity.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The heat in the exhaust gases from the\ncombustion turbine is recovered to generate additional steam. This steam, along\nwith that from the syngas process, then drives a steam turbine generator to\nproduce additional electricity.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<b><span style=\"color: red;\"><br /></span></b>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Coal is made to yield a\nclean-burning, synthetic gas (syngas), which is stripped of pollutants and\nimpurities and then burnt to produce power, with heat recovery providing steam\nto produce more electricity, and hence greater efficiency.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">IGCC plants can be used\nin India ONLY after its installation and maintenance costs are brought down. &nbsp;Conventional&nbsp;\nconventional pulverised coal (PC) facility is far cheaper .</span> <span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">IGCC\nis comparatively more expensive per kilowatt hour of electricity generated than\nother sources of energy.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">IGCC plants also use an\nestimated third less water than equivalent-sized conventional facilities.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">REPEAT \u2013 <b><span style=\"color: red;\">INDIA WILL NOT\nMOTHBALL HER COAL , COME WHAT MAY.&nbsp; </span></b><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b><span style=\"color: blue;\">WE INDIANS LOVE CO2 AND\nWE WILL MERRILY PUT IT INTO THE ATMOSPHERE. </span></b><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: purple;\"><b>BECAUSE INDIA KNOWS WHY\nGOD MADE THE OCEANS SALTY. </b></span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">NOT ONE WHITE MAHAMERU COULD\nFIGURE THIS OUT.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">NASA EVEN TRIED TO BULLSHIT THAT THERE IS ARSENIC IN DNA TILL\nTHIS BLOGSITE TORE THEIR ASS APRT AND MADE THEM APOLOGISE. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">I WAS THE FIRST ON THE\nPLANET TO RIDICULE NASA.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<b><span style=\"color: red;\"><br /></span></b>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2010/12/dna-nasa-arsenic-and-phosphorous-capt.html\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2010/12/dna-nasa-arsenic-and-phosphorous-capt.html</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<b><span style=\"color: red;\"><br /></span></b>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Carbon capture and\nstorage --&nbsp; catches and sequesters carbon\ndioxide (CO2) emissions from stationary sources like power plants..But we\nIndians will NOT remove CO2.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Flue-gas separation\nremoves CO2 with a solvent, strips off the CO2 with steam, and condenses the\nsteam into a concentrated stream. Flue gas separation renders commercially\nusable CO2, which helps offset its price.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Another process, oxy-fuel combustion,\nburns the fuel in pure or enriched oxygen to create a flue gas composed\nprimarily of CO2 and water -- this \u00adsidesteps the energy-intensive process of\nseparating the CO2 from other flue gasses.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A third technology, pre-combustion\ncapture, removes the CO2 before it's burned as a part of a gasification\nprocess.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Geologic storage\ninvolves injecting CO2 into the earth. We in India will NOT contaminate our\nunderground aquifers as we do NOT believe in fracking.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/JuJ8m2dFOEg/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/JuJ8m2dFOEg?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; These desh drohi foreigners will put formaldehyde, uranium, mercury, radium, lead etc without telling us.<br />\n<br />\nBelow the ground the fracking fluid is then pressure injected into the ground through a drilled pipeline\u2014and then they frack it more than 16 times<br />\n<br />\nThe mixture reaches the end of the well where the high pressure causes the nearby shale rock to crack, creating fissures where natural gas flows into the well.<br />\n<br />\nDuring this process, methane gas and toxic chemicals leach out from the system and contaminate nearby groundwater AQUIFERS \u2013 AND KILL BHARATMATA ..<br />\n<br />\nMethane concentrations are 17x higher in drinking-water wells near fracturing sites than in normal wells.<br />\n<br />\nWater gets contaminated, generations have DNA mutation and brain damage.<br />\n<br />\nThere have been over 1,000 documented cases of water contamination next to areas of gas drilling as well as cases of sensory, respiratory, and neurological damage due to ingested contaminated water.<br />\n<br />\nOnly 30-50% of the fracturing fluid is recovered, the rest of the toxic fluid is left in the ground and is not biodegradable.<br />\n<br />\nThe waste fluid is left in open air pits to evaporate, releasing harmful VOC\u2019s (volatile organic compounds) into the atmosphere, creating contaminated air, acid rain, and ground level ozone.<br />\n<br />\nHydraulic fracking produces approximately 300,000 barrels of natural gas a day, but at the price of ENORMOUS environmental, and health hazards.<br />\n<br />\nIF AT ALL WE DO IT\u2014WE SHALL DO IT ON OUR OWN. The smell was methane gas\nfrom the decomposing garbage buried under dirt. So the city put in wells and\nstarted pumping the methane out. First they burned it and then they started\nselling the gas to Cargill for heat to dry grain at a nearby grain elevator.\nNow the methane provides heat and electricity for the landfill operation, and\nextra electricity is sold to a local utility\".&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Methane collected from the\ngarbage now saves Fargo more than $300,000 a year. Terry Ludlum explains, \"If we say it's worth $4.00 a\nmetric ton, all of a sudden you're dealing with $600,000 of income\".</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot;
