Ajit Vadakayil</a></cite><span class=\"icon user blog-author\" style=\"background-image: url(&quot;data:image/png; background-repeat: no-repeat; display: inline-block; font-weight: bold; height: 18px; margin: 0px 0px -4px 6px; width: 18px;\"></span><span class=\"datetime secondary-text\" style=\"margin-left: 6px;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2015/12/thermal-coal-power-plants-clean-exhaust_9.html?showComment=1449808871372#c165780748243781177\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration: none;\">December 11, 2015 at 10:11 AM</a></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" id=\"bc_0_122MC\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; line-height: 22.4px; margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\nhttp://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/home/environment/global-warming/New-version-of-the-draft-Paris-agreement-released/articleshow/50130222.cms<br />\n<br />\nWE WARN MODI, DO NOT BITE OFF MORE THAN WHAT YOU CAN CHEW , WHEN IT COMES TO INDC . . .<br />\n<br />\nHAVE A PARAMOUNT CLAUSE GUARANTEEING ( AVOID THE WORD RESPECT ) NATIONAL SOVEREIGNTY . . .<br />\n<br />\nglean and dissect every single word . . read between the kosher lines . . ..BRAINSTORM AND THEN HAVE A REM SLEEP . . . . .<br />\n<br />\npunch into Google search - - - -<br />\n. . . . . . . .. . . . THERMAL COAL POWER PLANTS , CLEAN EXHAUST FLUE GAS EMISSIONS, PART 3 VADAKAYIL .. . . .. .. .<br />\n<br />\ncapt ajit vadakayil<br />\n..</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">QUOTE:&nbsp; Ocean storage, a technology still in its\nearly stages, involves injecting liquid CO2 into waters 500 to 3,000 meters\ndeep, where it dissolves under pressure. However, this method would slightly\ndecrease pH and potentially harm marine habitats :UNQUOTE<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><b style=\"background-color: lime;\">BALLS ! YOU NEED TO BE A CHOOT TO DO THAT !!!</b><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"></span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Cleaning coal and\nsequestering its emissions significantly raises the per-BT\u00adU price of what\nwould otherwise be an inexpensive fuel. While selling byproducts like gypsum or\ncommercial CO2\u00ad for sodas and dry ice can offset the price of clean coal\ntechnologies<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Carbon dioxide (CO2) is\na natural gas that allows sunlight to reach the Earth but also prevents some of\nthe sun's heat from radiating back into space, thus warming the planet.\nScientists call this warming the greenhouse effect. CO2 sustanis life on this planet\n. If we had no greenhouse effect, our planet would be an average temperature of\nminus 30 degrees Celsius) . <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b><br /></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b style=\"background-color: yellow;\">WE IN INDIA LOVE TO\nRELEASE CO2 INTO THE ATMOSPHERE.</b><o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b style=\"background-color: yellow;\"><br /></b></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b style=\"background-color: yellow;\"><span style=\"background-color: cyan; font-family: &quot;calibri&quot; , sans-serif; font-size: 11pt; line-height: 115%;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2015/03/begone-al-gore-hoax-of-carbon-dioxide.html\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2015/03/begone-al-gore-hoax-of-carbon-dioxide.html</a></span></b></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b style=\"background-color: yellow;\"><br /></b></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">\n\n</span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"></span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Real greenhouse gases include\nwater vapor ( harmless like CO2 ) , methane, nitrous oxide, hydrofluorocarbons,\nperfluorocarbons and sulfur hexafluoride.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Zionist Jew oil and\ngas industries have used carbon capture for decades as a way to enhance oil and\ngas recovery. &nbsp;Only recently have we\nstarted thinking about capturing carbon for environmental reasons.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">So if you\nPEE against the wind, do we in India need to do it too ?&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In your dreams !!!<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n\n</span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Post-combustion carbon\ncapture can prevent 80 to 90 percent of a power plant's carbon emissions from\nentering the atmosphere&nbsp; But the\npost-combustion process requires an enormous amount of energy to compress the\ngas enough for transport.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">With precombustion\ncarbon capture,\u00ad CO2 is trapped before the fossil fuel is burned. That means\nthe CO2 is trapped before it's diluted by other flue gases. Coal, oil or\nnatural gas is heated in pure oxygen, resulting in a mix of carbon monoxide and\nhydrogen.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This mix is then treated in a catalytic converter with steam, which\nthen produces more hydrogen, along with carbon dioxide. These gases are fed into\nthe bottom of a flask. The gases in the flask will naturally begin to rise, so\na chemical called amine is poured into the top.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The amine binds with the CO2,\nfalling to the bottom of the flask. The hydrogen continues rising, up and out\nof the flask. Next, the amine/CO2 mixt\u00adure is heated. The CO2 rises to the top\nfor collection, and the amine drops to the bottom for reuse . The excess\nhydrogen also can be used for other energy production processes.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Precombustion carbon\ncapture is already in use for natural gas, and provides a much higher\nconcentration of CO2 than post-combustion.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The precombustion process is lower\nin cost, but it's not a retrofit for older power plant generators. As with\npost-combustion, precombustion carbon capture can prevent 80 to 90 percent of a\npower plant's emissions from entering the atmosphere<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b><br /></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b style=\"background-color: yellow;\">BUT WE IN INDIA LOVE\nCO2 AND WE LOVE TO RELEASE IT INTO THE ATMOSPHERE.</b><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n\n\n\n\n\n</span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">With oxy-fuel\ncombustion carbon capture, the power plant burns fossil fuel in oxygen. This\nresults in a gas mixture comprising mostly steam and CO2. The steam and carbon\ndioxide are separated by cooling and compressing the gas stream.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The oxygen\nrequired for this technique increases costs. Oxy-fuel combustion can prevent 90\npercent of a power plant's emissions from entering the atmosphere.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b style=\"background-color: lime;\">BUT WE IN INDIA, LOVE\nCO2\u2014AND WE LOVE TO RELEASE IT INTO THE AIR.</b><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n\n</span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"color: magenta; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b>HUMAARA BAARAH CYLINDER WAALAH AKKAL KA DUSHMAN , ISSE BAHOOT AKKAL MAND HOI-- NAY --HAI !</b></span><br />\n<span style=\"color: magenta; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b><br /></b></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/eyeU4H2FaDI/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/eyeU4H2FaDI?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Carbon dioxide\npipelines are an existing part of the U.S. infrastructure -- in fact, there are\nmore than 2600 Km of CO2 pipelines in the U.S. today, mostly for enhancing oil\nproduction&nbsp; &nbsp;.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">TUM LOG KARO BHAIYYA\u2014FRACKING\nOR KRACKING OR WHAETEVER\u2014WE INDIANS WILL NOT HAVE CO2 PIPELINES.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: cyan; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b><br /></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b style=\"background-color: cyan;\">WE INDIANS LOVE\nRELEASING CO2 INTO THE ATMOSPHERE.</b><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n\n\n\n</span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Pipelines can transport\nCO2 in three states: gaseous, liquid and solid. Solid CO2 is commonly known as\ndry ice, and it's not cost-effective to transport. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Pipelines commonly\ntransport carbon dioxide in its gaseous state. A compressor \"pushes\"\nthe gas through the pipeline. Sometimes a pipeline will have intermittent\ncompressors to keep the gas moving. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The CO2 must be clean\n(free of hydrogen sulfide) and dry. Otherwise, it can corrode a typical\npipeline, which is made of carbon manganese steel.&nbsp; Pipelines built from stainless steel would\nhave a lowered risk of corrosion.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b style=\"background-color: lime;\">WE INDIANS LOVE\nRELEASING CO2 INTO THE ATMOSPHERE.</b><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n</span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Liquid CO2 requires low\npressure and a constant low temperature, so cargo tanks need to be both\npressurized and refrigerated underground storage. The pressure found deep\nunderground causes CO2 to behave more like a liquid than a gas.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Because it can\nseep into the spaces in porous rocks, a great amount of CO2 can be stored in a\nrelatively small area. Underground storage, also called geological\nsequestration, is already in use by the oil and gas industries to squeeze out\nextra oil or gas from depleted reservoirs.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Oil and gas reservoirs are well\nsuited to store CO2 as they consist of layers of porous rock formations that\nhave trapped oil and gas for years. Geological sequestration involves injecting\nCO2 into underground rock formations below the Earth's surface.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">These natural\nreservoirs have overlying rocks that form a seal, keeping the gas contained..<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b>WE IN INDIA WILL NOT DO\nALL THIS MAD STUFF.&nbsp; &nbsp;</b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b><br /></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b>TUM LOG KARO BHAIYA !&nbsp; &nbsp;</b></span><br />\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b><br /></b></span>\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b>THESE WESTERN CUNTS DO NOT KNOW WHAT TO DO WITH THOUSANDS OF KILOMETERS OF REDUNDANT FRANCKING CO2 PIPELINES . &nbsp;&nbsp;</b></span><br />\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b><br /></b></span>\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b>SHOVE IT !</b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">USKE\nBAAD GO AND SCREW YOUR NEIGHBOURS WIFE AND DAUGHTER , EKKATTA !&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">WE WONT DO IT !&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">CHUTNEY\nMARYs , PICKLE JOHNs AND WAANNABE GORAGAANDS ARE EXEMPTED . .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n\n\n\n\n\n</span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Basalt formations\n(volcanic rock) also appear to be suitable for storing CO2.&nbsp;&nbsp; Basalt is one of the most common types of\nrock in the Earth's crust -- even the ocean floor is made of basalt.&nbsp;&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">If you inject CO2 into\nbasalt, it eventually turns into limestone -- essentially converting to rock. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Sleipner gas field\noffshore in Norway has been injecting carbon dioxide into the sea floor since\n1996.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b><span style=\"color: magenta;\">TUM GORA GAAND LOG , ZAMEEEN AUR KHARA PAANI MEIN CO2 GHUSAAO BHAIYYA.&nbsp;</span></b></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; Cap-and-trade is\na vastly overpriced system with \u201call pain and no gain.\u201d&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Fraught with fraud, the\npotential for market manipulation in the aptly named cap-and-trade scheme is\nparticularly massive, since there\u2019s no actual physical commodity delivered.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">ONLY JEWS CAN SEE ALL THIS .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Behind the emotional\nfront of climate change lies a developing framework of KOSHER economic\nsolutions to the problem.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Two major market-based options exist, and politicians\naround the world have largely settled on carbon trading over its rival, carbon\ntax, as the chosen method to regulate GHG emissions.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Carbon trading, sometimes\ncalled emissions trading, is a market-based tool to limit GHG. The carbon\nmarket trades emissions under cap-and-trade schemes or with credits that pay\nfor or offset GHG reductions.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Cap-and-trade schemes\nare the most popular way to regulate carbon dioxide ( which is NOT a damaging greenhouse\ngas ) &nbsp;and other emissions.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The scheme's governing\nbody begins by setting a cap on allowable emissions. It then distributes or\nauctions off emissions allowances that total the cap. Member firms that do not\nhave enough allowances to cover their emissions must either make reductions or\nbuy another firm's spare credits.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;HEY ,\nI AM STILL WAITING FOR SOME KOSHER GUY TO BUY MY CARBON SHIT AND METHANE FART .&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">.Members with extra allowances can sell them or bank them for future use.\nCap-and-trade schemes can be either mandatory or voluntary.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A successful\ncap-and-trade scheme relies on a strict but feasible cap that decreases\nemissions over time. If the cap is set too high, an excess of emissions will\nenter the atmosphere and the scheme will have no effect on the environment.&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/v2jGcQ81EMA/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/v2jGcQ81EMA?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A\nhigh cap can also drive down the value of allowances, causing losses in firms\nthat have reduced their emissions and banked credits. If the cap is set too\nlow, allowances are scarce and overpriced.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Some cap and trade schemes have\nsafety valves to keep the value of allowances within a certain range. If the\nprice of allowances gets too high, the scheme's governing body will release\nadditional credits to stabilize the price.&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/aEaFzhoS67I/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/aEaFzhoS67I?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The price of allowances is usually a\nfunction of supply and demand.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Credits are similar to\ncarbon offsets except that they're often used in conjun\u00adction with\ncap-and-trade schemes. Firms that wish to reduce below target may fund\npreapproved emissions reduction projects at other sites or even in other\ncountries.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; text-align: center;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<span style=\"color: red; font-size: x-large;\"><b>Big brother will shine a torch into your wife's cervix after dilating it with you know what !!</b></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">He stated: \u201cIt is built\naround the charismatic presence of the ex-vice president Al Gore, whose crusade\nis to persuade the world of the dangers of climate change caused by global\nwarming\u2026It is now common ground that this is not simply a science film-\nalthough it is based substantially on science research and opinion, but it is clearly\na political film.\u201d</span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Speaking before a 2007\nJoint House Hearing of the Energy Science Committee, Gore told members: \u201cAs\nsoon as carbon has a price, you\u2019re going to see a wave of investmen in it\u2026There\nwill be unchained investment.\u201d<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">After all, what better\nway to reduce evil carbon than to make it a profitable commodity? But\nunfortunately for GIM and CCX investors, trading hot air credits proved just\ntoo good to be true.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Between May of 2008 and\nOctober of 2009 the CCX market value for one metric ton of carbon plummeted\nfrom $7 per metric ton to $0.10 along with the shareholders\u2019 investment values.\n<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n</span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">First Solar Inc.,\nanother GIM investment, got squeezed out of the solar panel market by cheaper\nChinese products. According to Bloomberg, GIM dumped its last First Solar stock\nat a $165.9 million loss in 2012.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">I once\nwent for briefing to Holland . , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">If romance with\nincreasing reliance upon renewables isn\u2019t being strained enough by painful\nelectricity costs, power blackouts are adding to buyer\u2019s remorse. The don\u2019t tell\nyou this too.&nbsp; The German energy industry\ngroup BDEW warns that the surge of renewables is increasingly clogging the\npower grid operational efficiency.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A&nbsp; 2009 study reported by CEPOS, a Danish think\ntank, found that while wind provided 19% of Denmark\u2019s&nbsp; electricity generation, it only met a mere\n4.9% of the total&nbsp; load demand .. They don\u2019t\ntell you all this .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Since Denmark can\u2019t use\nall the electricity it produces at night, it exports about half of its extra\nsupply to Norway and Sweden where hydroelectric power can be switched on and\noff to balance their grids. Still, even with those export sales, high\ngovernment wind subsidies cause Danish customers to pay the highest electricity\nrates in Europe.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;\">DO NOT HOOK UP WIND/ SOLAR ENERGY TO THE MAIN GRID-KEEP IT INDEPENDENT FOR SELECTED NON-CRITICAL UTILITIES ONLY&nbsp;</span></div>\n<b><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></b>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In 2011, U.K. wind\nturbines produced energy at about 21% of rated installed capacity (again, not\ndemand capacity). &nbsp;And this was during\n\u201cgood\u201d wind conditions. &nbsp;As in Germany,\nunreliability in meeting power demands has necessitated importation of nuclear\npower from France. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Also similar to\nGermany, the government is closing some of its older coal-fired plants\u2013 any ONE\nof which can produce MORE THAN TWICE MORE more electricity than all of\nBritain\u2019s 3,000 wind turbines combined.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; Other\ncalcifers include marine snails (pteropods); shellfish (clams, etc.);\ncrustaceans such as shrimp and lobsters; starfish, sea urchins and their kin\n(echinoderms); even single-celled amobae called foraminifera and photosynthetic\nalgae called coccolithophores, which encase themselves in calcium carbonate\nplatelets<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%; mso-ascii-theme-font: major-latin; mso-bidi-font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;; mso-hansi-theme-font: major-latin;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%; mso-ascii-theme-font: major-latin; mso-bidi-font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;; mso-hansi-theme-font: major-latin;\">Instead, most exists as the bicarbonate ion HCO3-. &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%; mso-ascii-theme-font: major-latin; mso-bidi-font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;; mso-hansi-theme-font: major-latin;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%; mso-ascii-theme-font: major-latin; mso-bidi-font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;; mso-hansi-theme-font: major-latin;\">Hey, you Paris <b><span style=\"color: red;\">COP21 CUNTs </span></b>&nbsp;have you got this ?<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 150%; mso-ascii-theme-font: major-latin; mso-bidi-font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;; mso-hansi-theme-font: major-latin;\">Alkalinity\nis sometimes incorrectly used interchangeably with basicity.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 150%; mso-ascii-theme-font: major-latin; mso-bidi-font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;; mso-hansi-theme-font: major-latin;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 150%; mso-ascii-theme-font: major-latin; mso-bidi-font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;; mso-hansi-theme-font: major-latin;\">For example, the\npH of a solution can be lowered by the addition of CO</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 150%; mso-ascii-theme-font: major-latin; mso-bidi-font-family: &quot;Cambria Math&quot;; mso-hansi-theme-font: major-latin;\">\u2082</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 150%; mso-ascii-theme-font: major-latin; mso-bidi-font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;; mso-hansi-theme-font: major-latin;\">. This will reduce the\nbasicity; however, the alkalinity will remain unchanged.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 150%; mso-ascii-theme-font: major-latin; mso-bidi-font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;; mso-hansi-theme-font: major-latin;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 150%; mso-ascii-theme-font: major-latin; mso-bidi-font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;; mso-hansi-theme-font: major-latin;\">You see, in common\nuse, \u201calkaline\u201d is used to mean \u201cbasic\u201d or \u201copposite of acidic\u201d. That isn\u2019t\nstrictly correct; though often the two things, alkalinity and basicity, are\n\u2018fellow travelers\u2019 in chemical reactions, so folks commonly treat them as the\nsame thing. They are not.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 150%; mso-ascii-theme-font: major-latin; mso-bidi-font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;; mso-hansi-theme-font: major-latin;\">An\nacid is a proton donor (there are a couple of other definitions too, such as\nbased on electron pairs or \u2026) where a base is a proton acceptor.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 150%; mso-ascii-theme-font: major-latin; mso-bidi-font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;; mso-hansi-theme-font: major-latin;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 150%; mso-ascii-theme-font: major-latin; mso-bidi-font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;; mso-hansi-theme-font: major-latin;\">Alkaline does\nnot mean that. It means a specific neutralization point related to carbonate.\nThat difference makes all the difference in the world as it relates to CO</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 150%; mso-ascii-theme-font: major-latin; mso-bidi-font-family: &quot;Cambria Math&quot;; mso-hansi-theme-font: major-latin;\">\u2082</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 150%; mso-ascii-theme-font: major-latin; mso-bidi-font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;; mso-hansi-theme-font: major-latin;\">.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 150%; mso-ascii-theme-font: major-latin; mso-bidi-font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;; mso-hansi-theme-font: major-latin;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 150%; mso-ascii-theme-font: major-latin; mso-bidi-font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;; mso-hansi-theme-font: major-latin;\">Adding\nCO</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 150%; mso-ascii-theme-font: major-latin; mso-bidi-font-family: &quot;Cambria Math&quot;; mso-hansi-theme-font: major-latin;\">\u2082</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 150%; mso-ascii-theme-font: major-latin; mso-bidi-font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;; mso-hansi-theme-font: major-latin;\"> to sea water &nbsp;does NOT \u201cincrease acidity\u201d as the ocean is\nnot acidic, it is basic (8.3 pH ). More importantly, adding CO</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 150%; mso-ascii-theme-font: major-latin; mso-bidi-font-family: &quot;Cambria Math&quot;; mso-hansi-theme-font: major-latin;\">\u2082</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 150%; mso-ascii-theme-font: major-latin; mso-bidi-font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;; mso-hansi-theme-font: major-latin;\"> also does not make the\nocean \u201cless alkaline\u201d either!<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 150%; mso-ascii-theme-font: major-latin; mso-bidi-font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;; mso-hansi-theme-font: major-latin;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 150%; mso-ascii-theme-font: major-latin; mso-bidi-font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;; mso-hansi-theme-font: major-latin;\">At\nneutral pH values:<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 150%; mso-ascii-theme-font: major-latin; mso-bidi-font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;; mso-hansi-theme-font: major-latin;\">CO</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 150%; mso-ascii-theme-font: major-latin; mso-bidi-font-family: &quot;Cambria Math&quot;; mso-hansi-theme-font: major-latin;\">\u2082</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 150%; mso-ascii-theme-font: major-latin; mso-bidi-font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;; mso-hansi-theme-font: major-latin;\"> + H</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 150%; mso-ascii-theme-font: major-latin; mso-bidi-font-family: &quot;Cambria Math&quot;; mso-hansi-theme-font: major-latin;\">\u2082</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 150%; mso-ascii-theme-font: major-latin; mso-bidi-font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;; mso-hansi-theme-font: major-latin;\">O \u2192 HCO</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 150%; mso-ascii-theme-font: major-latin; mso-bidi-font-family: &quot;Cambria Math&quot;; mso-hansi-theme-font: major-latin;\">\u2083</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 150%; mso-ascii-theme-font: major-latin; mso-bidi-font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;; mso-hansi-theme-font: major-latin;\">\u2212 + H+<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 150%; mso-ascii-theme-font: major-latin; mso-bidi-font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;; mso-hansi-theme-font: major-latin;\">At high\npH values:<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 150%; mso-ascii-theme-font: major-latin; mso-bidi-font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;; mso-hansi-theme-font: major-latin;\">CO</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 150%; mso-ascii-theme-font: major-latin; mso-bidi-font-family: &quot;Cambria Math&quot;; mso-hansi-theme-font: major-latin;\">\u2082</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 150%; mso-ascii-theme-font: major-latin; mso-bidi-font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;; mso-hansi-theme-font: major-latin;\"> + H</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 150%; mso-ascii-theme-font: major-latin; mso-bidi-font-family: &quot;Cambria Math&quot;; mso-hansi-theme-font: major-latin;\">\u2082</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 150%; mso-ascii-theme-font: major-latin; mso-bidi-font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;; mso-hansi-theme-font: major-latin;\">O \u2192 HCO</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 150%; mso-ascii-theme-font: major-latin; mso-bidi-font-family: &quot;Cambria Math&quot;; mso-hansi-theme-font: major-latin;\">\u2083</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 150%; mso-ascii-theme-font: major-latin; mso-bidi-font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;; mso-hansi-theme-font: major-latin;\"> \u00b2- + 2H+<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 150%; mso-ascii-theme-font: major-latin; mso-bidi-font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;; mso-hansi-theme-font: major-latin;\">So,\nso, so-<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 150%; mso-ascii-theme-font: major-latin; mso-bidi-font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;; mso-hansi-theme-font: major-latin;\"><br /></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n</span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 150%; mso-ascii-theme-font: major-latin; mso-bidi-font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;; mso-hansi-theme-font: major-latin;\">When a\n<b style=\"background-color: yellow;\">creamy shit later Paris COP21 CHOOT </b>moans &nbsp;about \u201cocean acidification\u201d and CO2, give him\na kick on his KOSHER ass and tell him that the ocean is alkaline and adding\nmore CO2 to the ocean does not change the alkalinity at all.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 150%; mso-ascii-theme-font: major-latin; mso-bidi-font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;; mso-hansi-theme-font: major-latin;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 150%; mso-ascii-theme-font: major-latin; mso-bidi-font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;; mso-hansi-theme-font: major-latin;\">After that drag him by his nostrils to China\nTown.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 150%; mso-ascii-theme-font: major-latin; mso-bidi-font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;; mso-hansi-theme-font: major-latin;\"><br /></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"comment-header\" id=\"bc_0_50M\" kind=\"m\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; line-height: 22.4px; margin: 0px 0px 8px;\">\n<cite class=\"user blog-author\" style=\"font-style: normal; font-weight: bold;\"><a href=\"https://www.blogger.com/profile/14410812789424637654\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration: none;\">Capt. Ajit Vadakayil</a></cite><span class=\"icon user blog-author\" style=\"background-image: url(&quot;data:image/png; background-repeat: no-repeat; display: inline-block; font-weight: bold; height: 18px; margin: 0px 0px -4px 6px; width: 18px;\"></span><span class=\"datetime secondary-text\" style=\"margin-left: 6px;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2015/12/thermal-coal-power-plants-clean-exhaust_6.html?showComment=1449501180414#c9168533199184852375\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration: none;\">December 7, 2015 at 8:43 PM</a></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%; mso-ascii-theme-font: major-latin; mso-bidi-font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;; mso-hansi-theme-font: major-latin;\"></span><br />\n<div class=\"comment-content\" id=\"bc_0_50MC\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; line-height: 22.4px; margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\n<div style=\"background-color: #cccccc;\">\nSTOP PRESS:</div>\n<div style=\"background-color: #cccccc;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"background-color: #cccccc;\">\nWHY HAS PM MODIs ADVISERS ALLOWED ANGELA MERKEL TO FOOL HIM WITH WIND/ SOLAR POWER ?</div>\n<div style=\"background-color: #cccccc;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"background-color: #cccccc;\">\nGERMAN GREEN ENERGY INDUSTRIES WERE GOING BANKRUPT\u2014INDIA HAS SAVED THEM.</div>\n<div style=\"background-color: #cccccc;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"background-color: #cccccc;\">\nWE NEED EMP HARDENED POWER GRIDS \u2013WE WILL NOT ALLOW COMPROMISE ON THIS.</div>\n<div style=\"background-color: #cccccc;\">\nFORGET HI FI AUTOMATIN AND SMART GRIDS FOR A WHILE. LET US NOT GRADUATE FROM CRAWL TO RUN.. WE NEED TO WALK FIRST.</div>\n<div style=\"background-color: #cccccc;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"background-color: #cccccc;\">\nIn June 2015, northern Germany\u2019s power grid suffered a major bottleneck that led to the overload of the Flensburg-Nieb\u00fcll power transmission line in Schleswig Holstein.</div>\n<div style=\"background-color: #cccccc;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"background-color: #cccccc;\">\nNorth German transformer stations constantly overloaded by wind power and they did NOT know how to control it.</div>\n<div style=\"background-color: #cccccc;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"background-color: #cccccc;\">\nThe overload resulted from a power surge from North Sea wind parks when winds picked up a bit.</div>\n<div style=\"background-color: #cccccc;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"background-color: #cccccc;\">\nWhat is unusual in this case, however, is that there was no storm present and the overload was caused by normal wind fluctuations.</div>\n<div style=\"background-color: #cccccc;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"background-color: #cccccc;\">\nThus the incident illustrates the increasing volatility of wind as a power supply, even under regular weather conditions.</div>\n<div style=\"background-color: #cccccc;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"background-color: #cccccc;\">\nDesperate intervening in power grids to avert a widespread power supply breakdown is nothing new in Germany.</div>\n<div style=\"background-color: #cccccc;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"background-color: #cccccc;\">\nThe average interventions in 2015 is 61, 000 repeat SIXTY ONE THOUSAND times a month.</div>\n<div style=\"background-color: #cccccc;\">\nWe will NOT allow this in India.</div>\n<div style=\"background-color: #cccccc;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"background-color: #cccccc;\">\nAPCO Modi be very clear on this. We need to see you being loyal to the WATAN than running after personal glory\u2014 like Barkha Dutt said .</div>\n<div style=\"background-color: #cccccc;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"background-color: #cccccc;\">\nShe has a point here.</div>\n<div style=\"background-color: #cccccc;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"background-color: #cccccc;\">\nDon\u2019t make me say more !</div>\n<div style=\"background-color: #cccccc;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"background-color: #cccccc;\">\nZOR KA JHATKA LAGEGA !!</div>\n<div style=\"background-color: #cccccc;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"background-color: #cccccc;\">\nAs winds pick up with little warning, engineers at control centers constantly have to keep a close eye out and be ready to act at a minute\u2019s notice and intervene if the power surges (or drops) to dangerous limits.</div>\n<div style=\"background-color: #cccccc;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"background-color: #cccccc;\">\nTo prevent overloading of the grid, control centers often have to shut down wind parks until the power supply moves into a safe range. These unplanned wind park shutdowns are occurring more and more often.</div>\n<div style=\"background-color: #cccccc;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"background-color: #cccccc;\">\nNot only is grid stability a problem, but \u201cwaste power\u201d is also growing astronomically.</div>\n<div style=\"background-color: #cccccc;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"background-color: #cccccc;\">\nThe 555 gigawatt-hrs of renewable power went unused in 2013 because of overloading and the surplus had to be discarded. The trend of \u201cwaste electricity\u201d is skyrocketing.</div>\n<div style=\"background-color: #cccccc;\">\n<br /></div>\n<span style=\"background-color: #cccccc;\">WHY HAVE YOU ALLOWED </span><b style=\"background-color: yellow;\">JEWESS ANGELA MERKEL </b><span style=\"background-color: #cccccc;\">TO FOOL YOU , MR NARENDRA MODI?</span><br />\n<div style=\"background-color: #cccccc;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"background-color: #cccccc;\">\nWaste electricity still needs to be paid for, which means that consumers foot a bill for something that is never delivered.</div>\n<div style=\"background-color: #cccccc;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"background-color: #cccccc;\">\nConsumers are also required to pay for the electricity that doesn\u2019t get produced when a wind park gets shut down. Wind park operators get paid whether they feed in or not.</div>\n<div style=\"background-color: #cccccc;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"background-color: #cccccc;\">\nWE AT SEA ARE FAMILIAR WITH DUMPING STEAM FROM THE BOILERS. Every time you dump steam we lose water.</div>\n<div style=\"background-color: #cccccc;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"background-color: #cccccc;\">\nOne solution for the German grid overloading from the uncontrollable wind and sun sources would be to vastly expand the German national power grid so that wind power produced near the North and Baltic seas power could get transmitted to the industrial south, where demand is big.</div>\n<div style=\"background-color: #cccccc;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"background-color: #cccccc;\">\nBut here too the costs of building the such transmission power lines are astronomical.</div>\n<div style=\"background-color: #cccccc;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"background-color: #cccccc;\">\nWith the German grid often becoming hopelessly overloaded and with no real expansion in sight, the future looks bleak for wind and solar power systems suppliers.</div>\n<div style=\"background-color: #cccccc;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"background-color: #cccccc;\">\nWith no place to send the power, there\u2019s no need for new installations. text-align: center;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">At the simplest level,\nthink of our distribution grid as akin to a mains water distribution system. In\norder to function, the pipes in such a system need to be filled at all times\nwith a volume of water equal to their capacity and, in order to flow in the\ndirection of a user, the water within the pipes needs to be maintained at a\nconstant pressure.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Where a household turns\non a tap, water flows out of the tap (in electrical terms \u201cthe load\u201d); at the\nother end an equal volume of water is fed into the system and pumps fire up to\nmaintain the pressure within it (although gravity often does the work).<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In a similar fashion,\nan electricity grid can only function with the required volume of electricity\nwithin it; maintained at a constant pressure (voltage) and frequency (hertz) \u2013\nall of which fluctuate, depending on the load and the input.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: x-large;\"><b style=\"background-color: yellow;\">While wind and solar\nnameplate capacity represented <span style=\"color: blue;\">85.1 % </span>of Germany\u2019s average electric power\ngeneration of 72 GW, it ultimately generated only &nbsp;<span style=\"color: blue;\">9.93 %</span> of total electricity.</b></span><span style=\"font-size: 12pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The standard measure of\nthat shortfall in electricity production compared to nameplate capacity is the\n\u201ccapacity factor\u201d: the amount of electricity a generator produces in a year\ndivided by the amount it would produce if it ran at nameplate capacity.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The capacity factor in\nGermany is a pathetic &nbsp;15.93 %.&nbsp; By comparison, fossil-fueled plants can\nachieve capacity factors of 83% or more.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">If the point is to\neliminate greenhouse gases, why is the ENERGY KUNDI nay &nbsp;Energiewende turning to fossil fuels-ON THE\nQUIET SINCE LAST YEAR ?<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">OOPS ! <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b style=\"background-color: yellow;\">Kundi</b> means asshole in\nMalayalam .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">To avoid blackouts and\noverloads, due to unstable wind/ solar systems , the power grid has to match\ngeneration with consumption on a moment-to-moment basis, not on a yearly basis.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Since it\u2019s difficult\nand SUPER expensive to store electricity on a significant scale, the grid can\u2019t\nbank much excess electricity production to draw on later during shortfalls; it\nhas to reliably produce all the power demanded each moment, largely from\ngenerators then on line.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Wind turbines and\nphotovoltaic panels generate power when the wind and sun decree, often going\ndead when electricity is needed and then overproducing when it isn\u2019t.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Grid\nmanagers dread that kind of catastrophic unreliability, but it\u2019s a daily\nreality for wind and solar. Why does this take a retired ship-captain to tell you all this , APCO Modi ? &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Sure, extra\nsuper expensive automation can compensate\u2014but they go PHUTTTT during an EMP\nattack.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">To escape long\nblackouts many times a year, <b style=\"background-color: yellow;\">ENERGY KUNDI</b> is planning to back up every gigawatt\nof wind and solar average capacity with another gigawatt of gas or coal.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">As it builds its\nintermittent fleet it will not be able to shut down existing fossil-fueled\nplants; they will remain in service, complete with staff, maintenance, and\noverhead expenses and the entire infrastructure of transmission lines, coal\nmines, and gas pipelines.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: x-large;\"><b><span style=\"color: purple;\">Those coal and gas\nplants will emit large quantities of greenhouse gases even when </span><span style=\"color: red;\">idling in\nstandby mode.&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;</span></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">And because that dispatchable fleet is both\nnecessary and sufficient, the expense of a redundant wind and solar fleet\nrunning on top of it is pure waste from an economic standpoint. &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">That\u2019s one reason why <span style=\"background-color: yellow;\"><b>ENERGY KUNDIs &nbsp;</b></span>wind and solar are the highest-cost options\navailable for generating power.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; font-size: x-large;\"></span>\n<span style=\"color: blue; font-size: x-large;\">\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n</span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Coal is the largest and\nmost widespread fossil fuel resource providing 24 % of the world\u2019s energy.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Thermal coal or steaming coal&nbsp; is burned\nfor steam to run turbines to generate electricity either to public electricity\ngrids or directly by industry consuming electrical power&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">During power\ngeneration the coal is ground to a powder and fired into a boiler to produce\nsteam to drive turbines to produce electricity. Thermal coal demand rose\ndramatically since&nbsp; 2007 , primarily due\nto the increasing demand for power generation&nbsp; .</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Demand: Forecast to increase at a steady pace through</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Metallurgical coal or\ncoking coal is used in the process of creating coke necessary for iron and\nsteel-making. Coke is a porous, hard black rock of concentrated carbon that is\ncreated by heating bituminous coal without air to extremely high temperatures.\nDemand: Dramatically decreasing with decreased demand for steel.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">India alone accounts\nfor 12% of the global coal resources at over 132 billion tons (thermal &amp;\ncoking) of proven reserves, placing her at the third position globally behind\nthe USA and China.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">At the current rate of\nconsumption it is estimated that it will take more than 250 years to consume\nthe available coal reserves.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">83% of the existing coal\nreserves in India belong to the Non-coking category (grades E, F, G) which is\nconsumed mainly for Power, cement and fertiliser production.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">India has a total reserve of lignite of 38.76\nbillion tons, almost 80% of which is found in Neyveli, Tamil Nadu.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<span style=\"color: blue; font-size: x-large;\">\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n</span><br />\n<div class=\"comment-block\" id=\"c6926886056294140373\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; line-height: 22.4px; margin-left: 48px; position: relative;\">\n<div class=\"comment-header\" id=\"bc_0_144M\" kind=\"m\" style=\"margin: 0px 0px 8px;\">\n<cite class=\"user\" style=\"font-style: normal;
