text-align: center;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">China conducted a test\nof a new missile capable of taking out US satellites as a part of Beijing\u2019s\ngrowing arsenal in space warfare.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The\ntest of a Dong Neng-3 exoatmospheric vehicle took place on October 30 2015, and\nwas conducted from the Korla Missile Test Complex in western China&nbsp; &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This &nbsp;DN-3 test is the eighth anti-satellite missile\ntest China has conducted.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-nZ7vGWksSls/Vk4zKbkG67I/AAAAAAABCBc/9E49HwBbtQI/s1600/GridEx-III-LogoTR-scaled.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"640\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-nZ7vGWksSls/Vk4zKbkG67I/AAAAAAABCBc/9E49HwBbtQI/s640/GridEx-III-LogoTR-scaled.png\" width=\"488\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">No nation on this\nplanet is as reliant on satellites as the USA. <o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/w2oKnV1oKT4/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/w2oKnV1oKT4?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\">LET US IMAGINE A NORTH\nKOREAN HEMP ATTACK ON USA\u2014WHICH THEY ARE EMINENTLY CAPABLE OF.<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\">&nbsp;A HEMP attack would literally send thousands\nof small and mid-sized businesses in the United States into bankruptcy in less\nthan a millisecond. Other than customers printed statements, the banks would\nhave no records of any ledger sheet.&nbsp;</span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\">North Korea now possesses a highly\nadvanced third generation nuclear warhead that could destroy the United States\nwith a single blow. An EMP could destroy much of the electrical grid within the\nUnited States.&nbsp;</span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\">The largest vulnerability in the country\u2019s electrical grid is\nthe power-transmission infrastructure, which will suffer significant damage\nunder an EMP attack and is extremely difficult to repair. The transmission grid\nis composed of substations and transformers that step power up and down as\npower lines are switched in order to transfer high-voltage long disaster power\nto a lower voltage more suitable for consumer use.&nbsp;</span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\">This grid is essential to maintaining\nelectrical distribution if some power generation is lost, as this system can\nreroute electricity to where it is needed most. Substations are exposed to both\nEMP and the elements while situated in remote areas, are full of cables which\ncan act like antennas, and are dependent on telephone lines in order to\nfunction., transformers and capacitors, are very sensitive to both E1 and E3.&nbsp;</span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\">A\ngood model for this potential disorder is the New York City blackout of 1977.\nOn July 13, 1977, two lighting strikes caused overloading in the electric power\nsubstations of the Con Edison power company.&nbsp;</span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\">These lighting strikes, the\nequivalent of a minuscule fraction of E2, caused the Indian Point power plant\nnorth of the city to fail, as well as the subsequent failure of the Long Island\ninterconnection\u2014a regional, or larger, synchronized-frequency grid. Failure of\nthe Linden\u2013Goethals 230,000-volt interconnection with New Jersey resulted in\nthe protective devices removing overloaded lines, transformers, and cables from\nservice.&nbsp;</span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\">As a result, a power failure spread throughout the New York area. This\nblackout lasted only one day, yet resulted in widespread looting and the\nbreakdown of the rule of law throughout many New York neighborhoods. The\nestimated cost of the blackout was approximately $346 million, and nearly 3,000\npeople were arrested through the 26-hour period. The blackout in New York City\nresulted in an immediate breakdown of the social order.&nbsp;</span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\">The police were\noutmatched and had no chance of stopping such massive theft, largely having no\nchoice but to stand by watching the looters from a distance. In North Brooklyn,\na community of more than a million residents, only 189 police officers were on\nduty. The New York Police Department was completely overwhelmed in its efforts\nto preserve order. The social order degenerated so quickly that Time magazine\ncalled it a \u201cNight of Terror.\u201d&nbsp;</span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\">The August 2003 Northeast blackout that affected\nOhio, New York, Maryland, Pennsylvania, Michigan, and parts of Canada\u2014though\nmarked by less social disorder\u2014also demonstrated the potential effects of a\nwide-area EMP attack. During that incident, more than 200 power plants,\nincluding several nuclear plants, were shut down as a result of the electricity\ncutoff.&nbsp;</span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\">Loss of water pressure led the local authorities to advise affected\ncommunities to boil water before drinking it due to contamination from the\nfailure of sewage systems and other health threats. Many backup generators\nproved unable to manage the crisis.&nbsp;</span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\">The initial day of the blackout brought massive\ntraffic jams and gridlock when people tried to get home without traffic lights.\nAdditional transportation problems arose when railways, airlines, gas stations,\nand oil refineries halted operations.&nbsp;</span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\">Telephone lines were overwhelmed due to\nthe high volume of calls, while many radio and television stations went\noff-air. Overall, the blackout\u2019s economic cost was between $7 billion and $10\nbillion due to food spoilage, lost production, overtime wages, and other\nrelated costs inflicted on over one-seventh of the U.S. population.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\">U.S. could not survive as a unified civil\nnation with the long-term loss of the electrical grid. . An EMP attack would\nheavily damage the U.S. transportation sector, which would significantly impair\nrecovery efforts in the wake of an attack.&nbsp;</span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\">Transportation networks are crucial\nfor the supply of life-sustaining goods and services. These networks are\nincreasingly incorporating electronics into their systems, so the\ntransportation network is increasingly vulnerable to EMP.<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\">Since millions of\nvehicles are on the road at any given time, there will be accidents and\ncongestion that will impede movement, particularly in large metropolitan areas.\nStoplights and train crossing signals will shut down or malfunction. The\nlonger-term effects on the automobile and trucking infrastructure will hinge on\nthe ability to obtain fuel and the recovery of commercial power.&nbsp;</span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\">Police may be\nneeded to replace automated traffic controls at the same time that they are\ncritically needed for other emergency services. &nbsp;The U.S. rail network depends\ndirectly on electricity. Though passenger rail is only lightly developed in\nthis country, America depends heavily on rail for transportation of fuel, food,\nand unfinished products.<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\">But sea transport will\nbe essential to revitalization of the U.S. economy after critical recovery, and\nits resilience to EMP is therefore important. Cargo cranes contain upwards of\n100 vulnerable computers and sensors, and the distribution centers linking\nshipping containers with the U.S. trucking industry may be destroyed.&nbsp;</span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\">The U.S.\nfood infrastructure depends heavily on the transportation sector. The\nproduction of food in the U.S. is increasingly reliant on electronics in\nvehicles such as tractors and combines, which have similar EMP vulnerability to\nsemi-trailer trucks.&nbsp;</span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\">The storage of food is directly dependent on the\nelectrical infrastructure to power refrigerated warehouses, yet the\ndistribution of the nation\u2019s food supply is entirely at the mercy of the\ntrucking industry.&nbsp;</span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\">Without refrigerated warehouses and with increasing spoilage\nin supermarkets that have only three days of backup stock, the country\u2019s food\ninfrastructure will be only more dependent on the trucking sector</span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\">&nbsp;In the\naftermath of an EMP strike, the delivery of aid and restoration of order within\nthe first week of catastrophe will be crucial in order to prevent the permanent\ncollapse of the nation\u2019s cities.&nbsp;</span></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b><br /></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b><span style=\"background-color: lime;\">SINCE THE PAST FOUR\nCENTURIES, EVERY SINGLE FALSE FLAG ATTACK / HEGELIAN DIALECTIC ON THIS PLANET\nHAS BEEN CONDUCTED BY ZIONIST JEWS.</span><span style=\"background-color: cyan;\"><o:p></o:p></span></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This trend toward\ngreater automation and instrumentation means critical infrastructure systems\nare becoming increasingly vulnerable to EMP attacks.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A \u201csoft kill\u201d occurs\nwhen an EMP weapon creates a temporary disruption of the targeted system,\ncausing its operational functions to be temporarily suspended. &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;A \u201chard kill,\u201d on the other hand, is when\nthe EMP weapon causes permanent component damage rendering the targeted system\nfunctionally destroyed.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The first step in\nhardening a site that might be vulnerable to EMP attacks, is to change network\ncabling from copper to optical fiber. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This is effective,\nsince when an EMP &nbsp;induced \u201cspike\u201d of\nhigh voltage or radio frequency (RF) energy hits the network, the copper wires\nchannel the extra-generated power to the devices connected to the network. This\nmeans that potentially, a large number of devices can be harmed even in a\nsmall-scale EMP attack. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Copper cables still\ndominate the market, since they are cheaper than fiber optic. However, fiber\noptic cables are increasingly used in data centers, and their immunity from\nelectromagnetic attack would make such centers more secure in the event of an\nEMP attack.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;Another defensive measure is to secure the\npower supply to the site by using a motor-generator power isolator to produce \u201cclean\nmain power for internal distribution within the site.\u201d However the\nmotor-generator option might not work as a protection if a EMP is set off\ninside the building.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">An optical fiber (or\noptical fibre) is a flexible, transparent fiber made by drawing glass (silica)\nor plastic to a diameter slightly thicker than that of a human hair.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The electronics in hard\ndrives that are not specifically protected against EMP would probably be\ndestroyed, making it very expensive to recover the data that was still\nmagnetically stored on the hard drive.&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;The data would be corrupted on any computer\nhard drives that were spinning at the time of the EMP attack.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Nearly all broadcast\nstations, especially television stations, would go off the air.&nbsp; Due to the high level of computerized\nautomation, the equipment in most radio and television studios would be so\ncompletely destroyed that most commercial stations would be damaged beyond\nrepair.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Radio studios are actually more\nvulnerable to permanent damage than many portable radio receivers. Many\ncomponents such as large transformers, which are normally resistant to large\nvoltage transients, would be destroyed by the DC-like current induced by the E3\ncomponent of the pulse when they are connected to very long copper wires.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">If power companies were to keep adequate\nspare parts on hand, the repair time could be kept closer to the two-month time\nframe.&nbsp; Adequate parts are not currently\nbeing kept on hand, and, in most cases, there are very long lead times for\nreplacement parts for the electrical grid if the parts are not kept on hand by\nthe electrical utility.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Electrical and\ncommunications lines carried on overhead poles would be most susceptible to\nEMP.&nbsp; Although fiber optic lines will not\npick up EMP-induced currents, underground telephone and electrical lines would\nnot be completely immune.&nbsp;&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">After an EMP attack it\nis EVERY MAN FOR HIMSLEF\u2014there will be NO sentiments OR concern for tragedy\nkings. &nbsp;Knowledge is power . . <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;EMP will take out everything electronic,\nwhether it is connected to the grid or sitting unplugged on the kitchen\ncounter. Things connected to the grid may fry from the 100,000 volt surge\nbrought in through the power distribution lines.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Electronics with\ntransistors or integrated circuits are extremely sensitive to static\nelectricity, and can be destroyed by as little as 100 volts. Walking across a\ncarpet on a cold dry day and sparking to that door know is well over 1000\nvolts.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The surge created by the EMP in your electronic device will be\nsufficient to destroy them if they are not protected.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The goal of all must be\nto survive.&nbsp; Imagine yourself transported\nto a remote Indian village with NO electricity. Imagine what needs to be done\nto survive. &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Imagine a long haul for 6\nmonths. After a while money will NOT work. If you have something critical for\nsurvival, gangs will snatch it away and they wont hesitate to KILL.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Learn to live off the\nland. &nbsp;People living in high rises will have to come down even for a shit . .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">There are many things\nthat need to be done to prepare: learning survival skills, having land and\ngardening/preserving knowledge, and many other things. Having communications\nand some of the gadgets survive could mean the difference between surviving and\nnot surviving. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">WE IN KERALA BOAST\u2014 WE DO\nNOT HAVE A PROBLEM WITH SURVIVAL AFTER ANY SORT OF EMP ATTACK. WE HAVE ENOUGH\nOF FISH, COCONUTS, EDIBLE LEAVES, TUBER ROOTS, VEGGIES , FRUITS , CLEAN WELLS &nbsp;etc .&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;When a nuclear bomb is exploded above the\natmosphere, it releases gamma rays in all directions. The ones that head\ntowards the atmosphere strike air molecules and strip off electrons.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Those electrons and\ngamma rays head towards Earth, stripping even more electrons. This avalanche of\nelectrons, called the Compton Effect, interact with the Earth\u2019s electromagnetic\nfield, creating very strong magnetic waves.&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/fI2C4VlR1OM/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/fI2C4VlR1OM?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When a magnetic field\ncrosses a conductor, electrical current is produced. When this EMP magnetic\nwave crosses power lines, electronic equipment, anything conductive, current is\nproduced.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Enough current could be produced to create fires, exploding\ntransformers, extremely high voltage (current pushing through resistance\nresults in voltage) which can break down insulation and create arcing and short\ncircuits.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Dangerous places to be\nduring an Electromagnetic Pulse (EMP):<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>in flight of an\nairplane or helicopter;<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>trapped in the subway\nsystem;<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>on duty away from home and\nyour children<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>at school far away from\nparents;<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>in your car in the\ndesert far away &nbsp;from water;<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>hanging on to life\nsupport in the hospital <o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>locked in prison <o:p></o:p></i></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;\"><i>stuck inside deep mines&nbsp;</i></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n</i></span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>anywhere near a non-passive\ndesign nuclear plant!<o:p></o:p></i></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><br /></i></span>\n<span style=\"color: blue; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Below: Cascading power grid failure&nbsp;</i></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/SGWDBsQNilU/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/SGWDBsQNilU?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Northeast blackout\nof 2003 was a widespread power outage that occurred throughout parts of the\nNortheastern and Midwestern United States and the Canadian province of Ontario\non Thursday, August 14, 2003, just after 4:10 p.m. EDT<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Some power was restored\nby 11 p.m. Many others did not get their power back until two days later. In\nmore remote areas it took nearly a week to restore power<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The outage, which was much\nmore widespread than the Northeast Blackout of 1965, affected an estimated 10\nmillion people in Ontario and 45 million people in eight U.S. states.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The blackout's primary\ncause was a software bug in the alarm system at a control room of the FirstEnergy\nCorporation, located in Ohio. A lack of alarm left operators unaware of the\nneed to re-distribute power after overloaded transmission lines hit unpruned\nfoliage, which triggered a race condition in the control software.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">What would\nhave been a manageable local blackout cascaded into massive widespread distress\non the electric grid.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">According to the\nofficial analysis of the blackout prepared by the US and Canadian governments,\nmore than 508 generating units at 265 power plants shut down during the outage.\nIn the minutes before the event, the NYISO-managed power system was carrying\n28,700 MW of load. At the height of the outage, the load had dropped to 5,716\nMW, a loss of 80%<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In areas where power\nremained off after nightfall, the Milky Way and orbiting artificial satellites\nbecame visible to the naked eye in metropolitan areas where they cannot\nordinarily be seen due to the effects of particulate air pollution and light\npollution\u2014only we sailors in deep oceans have the privilege of seeing all this.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n</span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">As the current carried\nby a power line increases, it produces more heat through resistance. This\ncauses the metal conductor in the line to lengthen and sag between towers. If\nthe line sags too low, a flashover to nearby objects (such as trees) can occur,\ncausing a transient increase in current.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Automatic protective relays detect the\nhigh current and quickly act to disconnect the faulted line, and the load\npreviously carried by the disconnected line is transferred to other lines. If\nthe other lines do not have enough spare capacity to carry the extra current,\noverload protection in those lines will also trip, causing a cascading failure.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">To understand a\ncascading power failure, one must first understand the relationship between\ncurrent, voltage and impedance on an AC line. In general, Ohm's law for AC\ncircuits states that V = IZ where V is voltage, I is current and Z is\nimpedance.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">As load increases on a line in the power system, either because more\npower is being used at the end, or because generators or other transmission\nlines fail, the magnitude of impedance drops Thus, if voltage is held constant\nby the generators, the amount of current will increase.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This is generally what\nhappens under normal operation, and the lines are rated to function with\namounts of current much higher than what would be caused by lots of people\nusing air conditioning or a few isolated line failures.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n\n</span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Long transmission lines\nare very expensive, so if there is a short-circuit, it is important to almost\ninstantly isolate the line before high currents can do serious damage. By far\nthe most the most prevalent protection system in place is the impedance\nrelay.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">These devices measure impedance\nalong the line, and at the junction with lines to which it connects further up\nin the power grid network. The idea is that if a line, or any of its\nneighboring lines shorts out (perhaps by touching a tree) the extremely high\ncurrent from a short circuit to ground will result in very low impedance.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Again\nthis is because, by Ohm's law, Z = V/I. The impedance relay then trips circuit\nbreakers to isolate the line from the grid and protect it. However, when there\nis a significant spike in load, as there was on the afternoon of August 14,\n2003, the generators are unable to adjust quickly to the change in load, so\nvoltage across the remaining lines also temporarily drops.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">At this point,\ncurrent has also increased because load has increased, so impedance is very\nlow. The key point here is that the impedance relays cannot tell the difference\nbetween the low impedance caused by a short circuit, and that caused by the\nsudden drop in voltage and rise in current from the failure of several lines\nand generators.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Thus, when FirstEnergy's\nlines and generators failed, the impedance relay on the Sammis-Star line\ninterpreted the drop in impedance as a short ciruit and promptly tripped its circuit\nbreakers to protect the line. At this point, it was impossible for any sort of\nintervention to stop the cascade.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b style=\"background-color: yellow;\">HULLO-- &nbsp;KOTA AND QUOTA IIT ELECTRICAL BRAINS-- UNDERSTOOD?</b></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Once one impedance\nrelay trips simply because of a rise in load rather than by an actual short\ncicuit, the cascading power failure begins. This is essentially because the\nspike in current and drop in voltage that can cause a relay trip has reached a\ncritical mass.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Once the relay trips, the line is isolated from the rest of the\ngrid, so some other line must very rapidly take on the extra load from the\ntripped relay. Since this rapid change in load was already enough to trip the\nfirst line, having it suddenly shifted to some other line again produces low\nenough impedance to cause a relay trip.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This isolates the second line from the\ngrid and the whole process repeats itself, rippling through the grid extremely\nquickly. In fact, once the Sammis-Star 345 kV line tripped in 2003, it took\nonly a little over 5 minutes for 50 million people to lose power.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/xyPN10Ge9YE/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/xyPN10Ge9YE?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/s_IrsNHv4aQ/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/s_IrsNHv4aQ?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/74i3W69R448/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/74i3W69R448?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-size: x-large;\">AIYYOOOO TUM KYA BOTHA HAI MAAN</span></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In India when a EMP\nstrikes we have our lovely villages to run to.&nbsp;\nIt is better NOT to make our villages too much technologically oriented ,\nwith heavy dependence on advanced electronics systems \u2013these things could be\nbrought to its knees with cascading failures of &nbsp;critical infrastructure.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">INDIAN ARMY MUST HAVE\nSUFFICIENT HORSES , CAMELS , BICYCLES AND BASIC WW3 TYPE RELIABLE JEEPS WHICH CAN\nBE PUSH STARTED.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">New smart cities housing\nmilitary missile protection systems must have a \u201cstrong grid\u201d rather than a \u201csmart\ngrid,\u201d<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Long run lines, such as\nthe electric grid are the most vulnerable to an EMP or geomagnetic storm.&nbsp; Microgrids are an important part of the\nsolution.</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"></span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Power transformers are\nalso needed at every point where there is a change in voltage in power transmission\nto step the voltage either up or downed.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/8WmRl8l4MUI/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/8WmRl8l4MUI?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Because LPTs ( large power transformers ) are very expensive and tailored to customers\u2019 specifications,\nthey are usually neither interchangeable with each other nor produced for\nextensive spare inventories.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">We must have new systems in smart cities where we\ncan interchange transformers by flying on a heavy transport helicopter.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/ZqnckVDCElc/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/ZqnckVDCElc?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The typical\nmanufacturing process of an LPT consists of the following steps:<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">1. Engineering and\ndesign: LPT design is complex, balancing the costs of raw materials<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">(copper, steel, and\ncooling oil), electrical losses, manufacturing labor hours, plant<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">capability constraints,\nand shipping constraints.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">2. Core building: The\ncore is the most critical component of an LPT, which requires a<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">highly-trained and\nskilled workforce and cold-rolled, grain-oriented (CRGO) laminated<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">electrical steel.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">3. Windings production\nand assembly of the core and windings: Windings are<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">predominantly copper\nand have an insulating material.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">4. Drying operations:\nExcess moisture must be removed from the core and windings<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">because moisture can\ndegrade the dielectric strength of the insulation.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">5. Tank production: A\ntank must be completed before the winding and core assembly<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">finish the drying phase\nso that the core and windings do not start to reabsorb moisture.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">6. Final assembly of\nthe LPT: The final assembly must be done in a clean environment;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">even a tiny amount of\ndust or moisture can deteriorate the performance of an LPT.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">7. Testing: Testing is\nperformed to ensure the accuracy of voltage ratios, verify power<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">ratings, and determine\nelectrical impedances.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Transporting an LPT is\nchallenging\u2014its large dimensions and heavy weight pose unique<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">requirements to ensure\nsafe and efficient transportation. Current road, rail, and port conditions<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n</span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">are such that\ntransportation is taking more time and becoming more expensive.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The big thing the high\naltitude nuclear test did, was that it totally erased the shortwave radio band\nworldwide for over 45 minutes. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This was not calculated\nin advance and no one has figured out in direct mathematical terms why this\nhappened, but it did happen and from this there have been subsequent\ncalculations that theorize that any high altitude nuclear blast is likely to\nblack out all communications which have to traverse the ionosphere for a period\nof up to two hours. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A nuclear weapon could\nindeed be used to completely black out the &nbsp;military satellite communications for long\nperiods of time (in combat terms) . Nuclear weapons fired in sequence (10 or so\na day) at the edge of space could shut all satellite communications down.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Microcircuits must have\ndiode protection which can dissipate static electricity harmlessly.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>I once boarded a\nChemical tanker as a sailing MENTOR at Amsterdam. CHERA DYNASTY ( KERALA ) WAS MADE TAPE WORM.<br />\n<br />\nQUOTE: During Kali Yuga, Narada advised Rishis who were performing Yajna to decide who could be given the fruits of yagna among Trimurtis. Bhrigu was sent to test Trimurtis. The sage who had an extra eye in the sole of his foot visited Lord Brahma and Lord Shiva and went un-noticed in both these locations. At last he visited Vishnu and the lord acts as if he had not noticed Bhrigu. Getting angered by this act, sage Bhrigu kicked Lord Vishnu in the chest, to which Vishnu did not react and instead apologized to the Sage by massaging his feet. During this act, he squashed the extra eye that was present in the sole of Bhrigu's foot. However Lakshmi finds it as an insult and had left Vaikuntam onto Earth to Kolhapur and started meditating.[10]<br />\n<br />\nCONTINUED TO 2-</div>\n<span class=\"comment-actions secondary-text\" id=\"bc_0_220MN\" kind=\"m\"><span class=\"item-control blog-admin pid-1783552029\" style=\"display: inline;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-replies\" id=\"bc_0_220BR\" style=\"margin-left: 36px; margin-top: 1em;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"comment-replybox-single\" id=\"bc_0_220B_box\" style=\"margin-left: 48px; margin-top: 5px;\">\n</div>\n</span></li>\n<span id=\"bc_0_215b+seedDbD\" kind=\"d\">\n<li class=\"comment\" id=\"bc_0_221B\" kind=\"b\" style=\"margin: 0px 0px 16px; padding: 0.25em 0px 8px;\"><div class=\"avatar-image-container\" style=\"float: left; margin: 0.2em 0px 0px; max-height: 36px; overflow: hidden; width: 36px;\">\n<img kasperskylab_antibanner=\"on\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-DUOJiRC5obw/UwiDtflONuI/AAAAAAAAppU/hpxnNJK2CIw/s1600/*\" style=\"border: 1px solid rgb(238, 238, 238); max-width: 36px;\" /></div>\n<div class=\"comment-block\" id=\"c3613798906997336487\" style=\"margin-left: 48px; position: relative;\">\n<div class=\"comment-header\" id=\"bc_0_221M\" kind=\"m\" style=\"margin: 0px 0px 8px;\">\n<cite class=\"user\" style=\"font-style: normal; font-weight: bold;\"><a href=\"http://www.blogger.com/profile/14410812789424637654\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration: none;\">Capt. Ajit Vadakayil</a></cite><span class=\"icon user\" style=\"font-weight: bold;\"></span><span class=\"datetime secondary-text\" style=\"margin-left: 6px;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2015/12/thermal-coal-power-plants-clean-exhaust.html?showComment=1449284127549#c3613798906997336487\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration: none;\">December 5, 2015 at 8:25 AM</a></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" id=\"bc_0_221MC\" style=\"margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\nCONTINUED FROM 1-<br />\n<br />\nLord Vishnu bore human form as Srinivasa, left Vaikuntam, in search of Lakshmi, reached Tirumala Hills and started meditating. Lakshmi came to know about the condition of Srinivasa and prayed to Siva and Brahma. Siva and Brahma then converted themselves into Cow and Calf and Goddess Lakshmi had handed over the cow and calf to Chola king ruling over Tirumala Hills at that time. The Cow would provide milk to Srinivasa daily while it was taken for grazing. One day Cowherd saw this and tried to beat the Cow with staff but Lord Srinivasa had borne the injury. Getting angered by this Srinivasa had cursed the Chola king to become a Demon as dharma says Servants sin should be borne by Kings. The king prayed for mercy after which Srinivasa said to him, that the King should take next birth as Akasaraja and should perform marriage of his daughter Padmavati with Srinivasa.[10]<br />\n<br />\nLord Srinivasa went to his mother Vakula Devi on Tirumala hills and stayed there for a while. After curse Chola king took rebirth as Akasaraja and he had a daughter named Padmavati who was born in the Padmapushkarini situated at present day Tiruchanur in Andhra Pradesh. Lord Srinivasa married Padmavati at present day Narayanavanam in Andhra Pradesh and will return to Tirumala Hills. After few months Goddess Lakshmi had come to know about the marriage of Srinivasa with Padamavati and went to Tirumala hills to question Srinivasa. It is said that the Lord srinivasa turns into Stone right when he was encountered by Lakshmi and Padmavathi. Lord Brahma and Shiva appear before the confused queens and explain the main purpose behind all this - The Lord's desire to be on the 7 hills for the emancipation of mankind from the perpetual troubles of Kali Yuga. Goddesses Lakshmi and Padmavathi also turn into stone idols expressing their wish to be with their Lord always. Lakshmi stays with Him on His Chest on the left side while Padmavathi rests on His Chest's right side.[10] UNQUOTE<br />\n<br />\nMIND YOU VISHNU / SHIVA / BRAHMA ARE COSMIC ALLEGORIES --<br />\n<br />\nTHE DAYS OF ROTHSCHILD POISONING HINDU GODS IS NOW OVER.<br />\n<br />\nSATYA VACHCHAN<br />\nDAT 5TH DEC 2015<br />\nTIME 0819 IST<br />\n<br />\nhttps://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Venkateswara_Temple,_Tirumala<br />\n<br />\ncapt ajit vadakayil<br />\n..</div>\n<span class=\"comment-actions secondary-text\" id=\"bc_0_221MN\" kind=\"m\"><span class=\"item-control blog-admin pid-1783552029\" style=\"display: inline;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-replies\" id=\"bc_0_221BR\" style=\"margin-left: 36px; margin-top: 1em;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"comment-replybox-single\" id=\"bc_0_221B_box\" style=\"margin-left: 48px; margin-top: 5px;\">\n</div>\n</li>\n<li class=\"comment\" id=\"bc_0_222B\" kind=\"b\" style=\"border-bottom-width: 0px; margin: 0px 0px 16px; padding: 0.25em 0px 0px;\"><div class=\"avatar-image-container\" style=\"float: left; margin: 0.2em 0px 0px; max-height: 36px; overflow: hidden; width: 36px;\">\n<img kasperskylab_antibanner=\"on\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-DUOJiRC5obw/UwiDtflONuI/AAAAAAAAppU/hpxnNJK2CIw/s1600/*\" style=\"border: 1px solid rgb(238, 238, 238); max-width: 36px;\" /></div>\n<div class=\"comment-block\" id=\"c629862040856427561\" style=\"margin-left: 48px; position: relative;\">\n<div class=\"comment-header\" id=\"bc_0_222M\" kind=\"m\" style=\"margin: 0px 0px 8px;\">\n<cite class=\"user\" style=\"font-style: normal; font-weight: bold;\"><a href=\"http://www.blogger.com/profile/14410812789424637654\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration: none;\">Capt. I view the world alternately as separate from God (\u012a\u015bvara) and one with Him, through the eyes that are made clear with the ointment of yoga... We (K\u0101p\u0101likas) offer oblations of human flesh mixed with brains, entrails and marrow. We break our fast by drinking liquor (sur\u0101) from the skull of a Brahmin. At that time the god Mah\u0101bhairava should be worshipped with offerings of awe-inspiring human sacrifices from whose severed throats blood flows in currents. UNQUOTE<br />\n<br />\nFAKE Abhinavagupta and his FAKE maithuna sexual orgies were unknown to Indians<br />\n<br />\nRothschild\u2019s FAKE mutts lied about BLOW JOB ( FELLATIO-CUNNILINGUS position 69 by GURU cum LOVER ) INITIATION by yoginis termed YOGINI VAKTRA\u2014along with BINDU VISARGA SHAKTI ( semen drop fall ) .<br />\n<br />\nLet me quote Rothschild\u2019s historians and their IMMORAL writings about Kashmiri Shaivism..<br />\n<br />\nQUOTE: K\u0101p\u0101likas, the \"skull-men,\" so called because, like the L\u0101kula P\u0101supata, they carried a skull-topped staff (khatvanga) and cranium begging bowl. The K\u0101p\u0101lika ascetic imitated his ferocious deity, and covered himself in the ashes from the cremation ground, and propitated his gods with the impure substances of blood, meat, alcohol, and sexual fluids from intercourse. The aim was power through evoking deities, especially goddesses UNQUOTE<br />\n<br />\nCONTINUED TO 2-</div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"comment-replies\" id=\"bc_0_237BR\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; MUSLIM VOTE MAANGTHA HAI NA ?<br />\n<br />\nQUOTE: In modern Tamil Nadu, certain Shaivite cults associated with the goddess Angala Parameshwari, Irulappasami, and Sudalai Madan, are known to practice or have practiced ritual cannibalism, and to center their secretive rituals around an object known as a kapparai (Tamil \"skull-bowl,\" derived from the Sanskrit kapala), a votive device garlanded with flowers and sometimes adorned with faces, which is understood to represent the begging-bowl of Shiva UNQUOTE .<br />\n<br />\nQUOTE: One of the earliest references to a K\u0101p\u0101lika is found in H\u0101la's Prakrit poem, the G\u0101th\u0101sapta\u015bati (third to fifth century A.D.) in a verse in which the poet describes a young female K\u0101p\u0101lik\u0101 who besmears herself with ashes from the funeral pyre of her lover. Var\u0101hamihira (c500-575) refer more than once to the K\u0101p\u0101likas thus clearly establishing their existence in the sixth century.UNQUOTE<br />\n<br />\nVarahamihira lived 4700 years ago, NOT 1425 years ago . .<br />\n<br />\nhttp://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2011/08/mihira-muni-great-astrologer-cum.html<br />\n<br />\nhttp://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2014/02/devadasi-system-immoral-lie-of-temple.html<br />\n<br />\nhttp://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2014/11/all-animal-sacrifices-in-hindu-temples.html<br />\n<br />\nhttp://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2014/09/aghoris-corpse-eaters-of-india-capt.html<br />\n<br />\nYET MODI TRIES HIS BEST TO PLEASE JEW ROTHSCHILD\u2014THE MAN WHO RULED INDIA AND ROBBED BHARATMATA BLIND .<br />\n<br />\nPUT THIS COMMENT IN MODIs, RAJNATH SINGHs, PARRIKARs, AMIT SHAHs, RSS, WEBSITES.<br />\n<br />\nSPREAD THIS ON FACEBOOK AND TWITTER .<br />\n<br />\nALL THIS WONT WORK ANY MORE !<br />\n<br />\nCapt ajit vadakayil<br />\n..</div>\n</div>\n</span></li>\n<span id=\"bc_0_237b+seedDtD\" kind=\"d\">\n</span></div>\n<span id=\"bc_0_237b+seedDtD\" kind=\"d\">\n</span></ol>\n<span id=\"bc_0_237b+seedDtD\" kind=\"d\">\n</span></div>\n<span id=\"bc_0_237b+seedDtD\" kind=\"d\">\n</span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<br />\n<div class=\"comment-block\" id=\"c2951749553426189372\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc;
