text-align: center;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/d5T1vPmA-l4/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/d5T1vPmA-l4?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/V0hsCD4qZMk/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/V0hsCD4qZMk?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/Oa69VqwmjAk/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/Oa69VqwmjAk?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<b style=\"background-color: yellow;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\">CLEAN UP THE KACHCHRA ? &nbsp;OR STEAL VIMANAS STILL POWERED UP AND IN ORBIT AFTER 13,000 YEARS ?</span></b><br />\n<b style=\"background-color: yellow;\"><br /></b>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/1WSz4-7LGIk/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/1WSz4-7LGIk?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">PASSIVE systems ( with inherent\nsafety features , which require no human control ) can prevent grave disasters\nafter an EMP attack, which takes out the power systems. &nbsp;&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">They rely on pressure\ndifferentials, gravity, natural convection, or the natural response of\nmaterials to high temperatures.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Nuclear reactors while\nrunning normally, are essentially in a state of controlled meltdown as they\nheat water into steam which turns the turbines that produce electricity. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The flow of water\nrequires electricity, working pumps, and working electronic systems to control\nthem. If these electronic systems are damaged, or the electricity is OFF, &nbsp;they will need to keep the nuclear rods cool \u2013\neven when they are not \u2018running\u2019 in the reactor process.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;The cool down from the residual heat (of the\nradioactive decay) requires circulating water and operating pumps. Without\ncooling, the fuel rods will heat up to the point where they can melt.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<br /></div>\n<b style=\"background-color: yellow;\">SAFE THORIUM NUCLEAR REACTORS</b><br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/q5kxa94PE6Y/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/q5kxa94PE6Y?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">PRESSURISED WATER\nREATCOR &nbsp;ENSURES THAT CORE STAYS INSIDE\nVESSEL REACTOR DURING ACCIDENT<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">CORE COOLING AND\nCONTAINMENT COOLING MUST GO ON INDEFINITELY .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n\n\n\n</span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">SPENT FUEL POOL COOLING\nSYSTEM MUST BE CAPABLE OF COOLING , SPENT FUEL REACTOR INDEFINITELY<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Even a week after being\nshut down, the heat from a reactor core boils water at a rate of nearly 240\nlitres per minute; and after a month it\u2019s still boils off 160 litres a minute.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Separate from the\nscrammed rods of the reactors, there is the issue of the spent fuel rod.&nbsp; &nbsp;Storage pools of the containment facility.\nThey too need a constant supply of water.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Backup batteries will\nkeep pumps running for a day or so.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Diesel generators\n(assuming they or their electronics are hardened and not damaged from the\neffects of the EMP) will keep pumps running as long as there is diesel fuel on\nhand.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;A question is, do the nuclear plants have\nenough stored diesel fuel to keep the cooling pumps operating for months and\nmonths afterwards?<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">New designs with\nintegrated \u201cpassive safety\u201d systems stave off overheating when power is lost.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<b style=\"background-color: yellow;\"><br /></b></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<b style=\"background-color: yellow;\">THORIUM AND INDIA</b></div>\n<div style=\"text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/eCX4wXK6UXU/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/eCX4wXK6UXU?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<b style=\"background-color: yellow;\"><br /></b>\n<b style=\"background-color: yellow;\"></b><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Traditional reactor\nsafety systems are ACTIVE &nbsp;in the sense\nthat they involve electrical or mechanical operation on command systems (e.g.,\nhigh-pressure water pumps). &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;But some new\nmodel engineered reactor systems are PASSIVE, e.g., using pressure relief\nvalves to manage overpressure.&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<b style=\"background-color: yellow;\"><br /></b>\n<b style=\"background-color: yellow;\">FUKUSHIMA REACTOR MELTDOWN</b><br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/fyIBlygNlcc/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/fyIBlygNlcc?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<span style=\"color: red; font-size: x-large;\"><b><br /></b></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Passive nuclear safety\nis a safety feature of a nuclear reactor that does not require operator actions\nor electronic feedback in order to shut down safely in the event of a\nparticular type of emergency (usually overheating resulting from a loss of\ncoolant or loss of coolant flow). <o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/JMaEjEWL6PU/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/JMaEjEWL6PU?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Such reactors tend to\nrely more on the engineering of components such that their predicted behaviour\naccording to known laws of physics would slow, rather than accelerate, the\nnuclear reaction in such circumstances.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<span style=\"color: red; font-size: x-large;\">\n\n</span>\n<span style=\"color: red; font-size: x-large;\"><b>PASSIVE SAFETY URANIUM NUCLEAR PLANTS - &nbsp;V<span style=\"background-color: yellow;\">ERY IMPORTANT FOR INDIA&nbsp;</span></b></span><br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/mCB376gt9AU/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/mCB376gt9AU?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Parallel redundant\nsystems are still required. &nbsp;&nbsp;Combined\ninherent and passive safety depends only on physical phenomena such as pressure\ndifferentials, convection, gravity or the natural response of materials to high\ntemperatures to slow or shut down the reaction, not on the functioning of\nengineered components such as high-pressure water pumps.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<b style=\"color: red; font-size: xx-large; text-align: left;\">PASSIVE SAFETY URANIUM NUCLEAR PLANTS - &nbsp;V<span style=\"background-color: yellow;\">ERY IMPORTANT FOR INDIA&nbsp;</span></b></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/FCorzfw5liQ/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/FCorzfw5liQ?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Current pressurized\nwater reactors and boiling water reactors are systems that have been designed\nwith one kind of passive safety feature. &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In the event of an excessive-power\ncondition, as the water in the nuclear reactor core boils, pockets of steam are\nformed.&nbsp; &nbsp;These steam voids moderate fewer neutrons,\ncausing the power level inside the reactor to lower.&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<b style=\"color: red; font-size: xx-large; text-align: left;\">PASSIVE SAFETY URANIUM NUCLEAR PLANTS - &nbsp;V<span style=\"background-color: yellow;\">ERY IMPORTANT FOR INDIA</span></b><br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/xBDa4P1T26A/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/xBDa4P1T26A?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A grid failure\nresulting from an EMP attack will cause municipal systems to fail, even those\nwith backup systems as they will eventually run out of fuel. &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Nuclear power will automatically shut down\nwhen the grid fails<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">COOLING WATER / FROM GRAVITY TANKS MUST BE READY .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In some designs the\ncore of a fast breeder reactor is immersed into a pool of liquid metal. If the\nreactor overheats, thermal expansion of the metallic fuel and cladding causes\nmore neutrons to escape the core, and the nuclear chain reaction can no longer\nbe sustained. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The large mass of\nliquid metal also acts as a heatsink capable of absorbing the decay heat from\nthe core, even if the normal cooling systems would fail.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<b style=\"background-color: yellow;\">SHUT DOWN --WITHOUT AN OPERATOR--&nbsp;</b><br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/yx_XoqXNtRM/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/yx_XoqXNtRM?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Pressurized core\nflooding tanks, or accumulators, are used in some currently operating reactors as\npart of their emergency core cooling systems. &nbsp;They typically consist of large tanks about\n75% full of cold borated water . The remaining volume is filled with\npressurized nitrogen or an inert gas.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The contents of the tank are isolated\nfrom the reactor by check valves that are held shut normal operation by higher\npressure in the reactor. In the event of a Loss-of-Coolant Accident&nbsp; (LOCA), the reactor pressure will drop,\nopening the check valves and discharging the borated water&nbsp; into the reactor vessel. This is a one-time\ndischarge of cold water to buy time, of the order of minutes,&nbsp; prior to longer term emergency core cooling\nsystems starting up.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Accumulators do not provide Continuing heat removal.&nbsp; Elevated gravity drain tanks are like the\naccumulators, except they are driven by gravity rather than pressurized gas.\nThey therefore are effective when the pressure in the reactor core is not\ngreater than the weight of the water in the tank.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">They may be ineffective if\nthe core is uncovered and generating high pressure steam. In some advanced\ndesigns, the volume of water in the tank is sufficiently large to flood the\nentire reactor cavity.&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Elevated gravity drain tanks also provide only a\none-time discharge of water to buy time.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/_192FPyMMtY/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/_192FPyMMtY?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Sodium coolant is a\nhighly efficient heat-transfer material and has the additional advantage of\noperating at normal atmospheric pressure.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In the typical commercial reactor,\nthe water coolant must be pressurized at 100-150 times normal to keep it from\nboiling away.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">But sodium can cool the core at normal pressure, because its\nboiling point is 300-400 degrees Celsius higher than the core's operating\ntemperature.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The sodium pool\neliminates the possibility of the coolant boiling away during an accident and\nleaving the core uncovered, which is one of the more serious potential trouble\nspots in a light-water reactor. &nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">By\nsubmerging the core in thousands of litres of liquid sodium, you provide the\nreactor with an immense heat sink that adds greatly to its safety. &nbsp;If the reactor starts to overheat, the pool\ncan absorb vast amounts of heat and never approach its boiling point.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/JMaEjEWL6PU/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/JMaEjEWL6PU?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Passive systems remove\ndecay heat if the normal heat-removal systems fail. &nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">When a reactor shuts\ndown, it continues to produce heat, because the core contains a large inventory\nof radioactive material that releases energy as it decays. </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n\n\n\n\n\n</span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Natural convection in\nthe sodium pool can transport the decay heat to downstream systems. All of this\ncan be done passively, without need for active systems or components.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Sodium increases the\nreliability and long life of components, partly because it does not corrode\ncommon structural materials, such as stainless steel.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n\n</span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Materials and\ncomponents in the core can operate in liquid sodium without significant damage\nor corrosion.&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Sodium is chemically\ncompatible with the metal fuel. This makes small failures in the cladding, the\nstainless-steel tubes that encase the fuel, far less likely to grow. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In addition, sodium\ntends to bind chemically with several important radioactive fission products,\nwhich reduces radioactive releases if fuel fails. Although sodium can be\ndangerous if allowed direct contact with air or water, with appropriate care,\nit makes a nearly ideal coolant. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Properly handled,\nsodium offers significant advantages over water as a coolant.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/cBThTwFhRlA/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/cBThTwFhRlA?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Metallic fuel is an alloy\nof uranium and other metals. Metal fuel ( uranium , plutonium ,zirconium ally )\nprovides inherent, \"reactivity feedback\" mechanisms that alter a\nreactor's power when its core temperature changes.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The primary feedback in\na metal-fuel reactor comes from thermal expansion of fuel, sodium and steel\naround the core. Simply put, when the core temperature increases, the fuel,\nsodium and the stainless steel components in the core expand, and that tends to\nshut down the reactor.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When the fuel expands the\ndistances between the fissile nuclei increase. This slows the chain reaction,\nbecause the neutrons necessary to drive it strike fewer fissile nuclei.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Normally sodium and\nsteel around the core reflect neutrons back into the core to help maintain the\nchain reaction. But when sodium and steel expand, more neutrons escape from the\ncore and are unavailable to drive the reaction.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">These natural feedback\nmechanisms tend to maintain coolant temperature near its normal 500 degrees C\noperating value \u2014 well below sodium's 900 C boiling point \u2014 even when the\nreactor loses its engineered cooling systems. &nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">If an AFR started to\noverheat, the natural properties inherent in its materials and design would\nstep in to shut it down without the intervention of human operators or\nspecially engineered safety systems.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/kybenSq0KPo/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/kybenSq0KPo?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2010/03/gold-finger-ajit-vadakayil.html\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2010/03/gold-finger-ajit-vadakayil.html</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2012/07/scrap-sethusamudram-project-now-capt.html\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2012/07/scrap-sethusamudram-project-now-capt.html</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/lE13HAKpsqI/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/lE13HAKpsqI?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Coronal mass ejections\nfrom the sun causing power outages, and disruption of GPS and communications.\nWe would hardly get 10 hours notice.</span> <span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Solar activity can\nproduce x-rays, high-energy particles and coronal mass ejections of plasma.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Where such activity is directed towards Earth there is the potential to cause\nwide-ranging impacts. These include power loss, aviation disruption,\ncommunication loss, and disturbance to (or loss of) satellite systems. Coronal\nmass ejection \u2013 explosive eruptions on the sun which cause large parts of the\ncorona to blast away.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-HYDCQfh6fiM/VkM-OD2wQGI/AAAAAAABB0M/PBERNLQpLrE/s1600/Blog-3210-15-2015-750x340.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"290\" src=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-HYDCQfh6fiM/VkM-OD2wQGI/AAAAAAABB0M/PBERNLQpLrE/s640/Blog-3210-15-2015-750x340.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Most coronal mass\nejections are not emitted in the direction of Earth.&nbsp; Those that are typically take one to three\ndays to reach us, and we can predict the arrival time to within about six\nhours. Predictions are currently less accurate due to degradation in the\nsatellite capability available to forecasters.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/RDWOqpDMAok/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/RDWOqpDMAok?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Carrington event,\nfor example, travelled to Earth in as little as 18 hours.</span> <span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The\nsolar storm of 1859, also known as the Carrington event, was a powerful\ngeomagnetic solar storm in 1859 during solar cycle 10. A solar coronal mass\nejection hit Earth's magnetosphere and induced one of the largest geomagnetic\nstorms on record.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Carrington event is\noften described as the perfect storm. The modern day effects of a similar event\nwould include localised power outages; disruption of satellite operations,\nincluding to GPS and satellite communications; disruption to high-frequency\ncommunications; increased radiation to aircrew and passengers in flight,\nparticularly over polar regions; and further disturbances to small-part\nelectronic systems.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"color: red; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: large; line-height: 150%;\"><b>IS INDIA READY FOR A CME OR AN EMP ?</b></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/3uBi3Pc84ms/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/3uBi3Pc84ms?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The CME (a slower\nmoving cloud of charged particles than the X-ray burst), reaches the earth \u2013\nand the solar particles interact with earth\u2019s magnetic field to produce\npowerful electromagnetic fluctuations. &nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">It\nis these fluctuations that produce electrical currents in electrically\n\u2018conductive\u2019 things here on Earth, such as our criss-crossing power lines\nsuspended above our streets. <o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/JMaEjEWL6PU/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/JMaEjEWL6PU?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Electrical currents\nbuild up during the lasting event, and while some grid circuit breakers trip in\nan effort to save itself, many transformers and their high number of internal\nwindings of copper wire continue to heat up and overload until they burn up as\nthey exceed their design capacity.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b style=\"background-color: yellow;\">Below: Stuxnet, a joint\nU.S.-Israel project, is known for reportedly destroying roughly a fifth of\nIran's nuclear centrifuges by causing them to spin out of control.</b><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/fERbEUG01Uw/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/fERbEUG01Uw?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The worm subtly\nincreased the pressure on spinning centrifuges while showing the control room\nthat everything appeared normal by replaying the plant's protection system\nvalues while the attack occurred.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/1U6Nzcv9Vws/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/1U6Nzcv9Vws?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The\ngoal of the worm was not aimed at destroying centrifuges, but \"reducing\nlifetime of Iran's centrifuges and making the Iranians' control systems appear\nbeyond their understanding.&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-4jxJCHWDeBU/VkNJl7k9qqI/AAAAAAABB0c/ubDYzg56Y3M/s1600/iraewn-31.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"480\" src=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-4jxJCHWDeBU/VkNJl7k9qqI/AAAAAAABB0c/ubDYzg56Y3M/s640/iraewn-31.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Iranians are NOT stupid.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/tGQPZzFbLPE/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/tGQPZzFbLPE?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/qSWm_nprfqE/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/qSWm_nprfqE?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/UakeTEJlXGw/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/UakeTEJlXGw?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/BL_5xtrtN-M/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/BL_5xtrtN-M?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/EhkdYqNU-ac/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/EhkdYqNU-ac?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/4L31dHXP6i0/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/4L31dHXP6i0?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b style=\"background-color: yellow;\">DO NOT ALLOW FOREIGN ENEMIES TO TAKE DOWN OUR ELECTRICAL GRID WITHOUT THE USE OF EMPs--&nbsp;</b></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b style=\"background-color: yellow;\"><span style=\"color: red;\"><br /></span></b></span>\n<span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b style=\"background-color: yellow;\"><span style=\"color: red;\">THE INDIAN GOVT MUST NOT ALLOW FDI IN SMART POWER GRID</span> &nbsp;, &nbsp;LIKE WHAT YOU DID FOR INDIAN COMMUNICATIONS, IN A MINDLESS MANNER. &nbsp;</b></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b style=\"background-color: yellow;\"><br /></b></span>\n<span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\"><b style=\"background-color: yellow;\">DURING WW3 BHARATMATA WILL BE BLED TO DEATH , BY MINDLESS FDI IN CRITICAL SENSITIVE UTILITIES &nbsp;</b></span><br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/2c1sadZCO60/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/2c1sadZCO60?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Airbus has a\nfly-by-wire system in most all its planes. This means if the EMP hits, those\nplanes are likely doomed as the pilot will not be able to control them. The\nRussian passenger plane brough down over Egypt was this model.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;Boeing on the other hand has a back up system\nthat is mechanical. No electric needed, thus the pilots can still control the\nplane. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The efficiency of EMP\ndepends on the length of electronic circuits and the diameter of the the wires.\nModern electronics have microscopically thin circuits that are very sensitive\nto getting too hot and their total length can be many kilometers.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">EMP works against\nelectronics, by inducing electric pulse of voltage far exceeding the flimsy\nratings of 5V or so in wires nanometers thick, breaking through diodes,\ntransistors and capacitors, damaging the components.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Diesel engines would be\nentirely unaffected; once started they can run without any electricity at all.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Hydraulic control\nsystems powered directly by the engine and not relying on a computer to operate\nthe valves would continue to function, as would cable-driven control systems. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Simple electric motors\nmay also continue to operate (larger motors tend to be EMP-resistant, in\nsmaller motors there's a chance the EMP could burn out the windings or arc over\nand destroy the brushes) which means we can assume you'd still be able to pump\nfuel into the engines of most jet airliners.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Get a HAM radio\noperator\u2019s license and become active in the short-wave community--for a WW3 scenario.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">America\u2019s military\ncommanders are worried about the possibility of an attack on the United States\nby an electromagnetic pulse (EMP) weapon \u2013 so much so that the Pentagon plans\nto spend nearly $1 billion to move the North American Aerospace Defense Command\n(NORAD) communications into an EMP-resistant bunker.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Because of the very\nnature of the way that Cheyenne Mountain is built, it\u2019s EMP-hardened<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Cheyenne Mountain\noutside of Colorado Springs is the location of a giant bunker where NORAD\u2019s\nheadquarters was located from the 1960s until 2006. NORAD is the organization\nthat guards the United States and Canada from missile attacks.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Cheyenne Mountain\nbunker was designed to protect NORAD\u2019s equipment from Soviet nuclear missile\nattacks during the Cold War.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Defense Department\nhas signed a $700 million contract with Raytheon to install modern\ncommunications equipment in the facility.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The most recognized\nform of an EMP attack would involve a nuclear explosion high in the atmosphere\nabove the U.S., which would knock out the electrical grid and could create a\nnationwide blackout, perhaps for months or even up to a year. It would fry\nelectronics. If the grid is down for a year, at least two-thirds of Americans\nlikely would perish from starvation, a lack of medical supplies and civil\nunrest.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">All of the anti-missile\ndefenses created by MDA could be easily thwarted by the simple strategy of\nlaunching large numbers of decoy missiles at American soil.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The MDA spent $5.4\nbillion developing a weapon called the Airborne Laser that was so ineffective\nit was scrapped in 2012. The weapon was a laser beam designed to destroy\nmissiles in flight. It never worked and even if it had, the laser was fired\nfrom Boeing 747 jets that could be shot down by enemy missiles or fighter\nplanes.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Another weapon, the\nKinetic Energy interceptor, was designed to d</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">estroy other missiles but was\nabandoned because it was too big to fit on Navy ships. It cost $1.7 billion.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A third weapons system,\nthe Multiple Kill Vehicle, was so ineffective it was never tested even though\nthe MDA spent $700 million on it.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The cornerstone of the\nmissile defense efforts, a floating radar system called the Sea Based X Band\nRadar, or SBX, is also a failure. The SBX was incapable of tracking the most\nlikely enemy missile attack even though it cost $2.2 billion.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Russians know how\nto send decoys along with real missiles, U.S. radars will be fooled, causing\nrocket-interceptors to be fired at the wrong objects \u2014 and increasing the risk\nthat actual warheads would slip through.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The International\nElectrotechnical Commission defines three components associated with a nuclear\nelectromagnetic pulse: E1, E2, and E3.&nbsp;&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The E1 pulse is brief,\nintense, and very quick (traveling at over 90% of the speed of light), and can\ntake out computers and telecommunications equipment owing to its ability to\nexceed voltage limitations. E1 HEMP ( H stands for High ) is an electromagnetic\nsignal that is generated by a nuclear burst that explodes high above the Earth\n\u2013 generally said to be \u201cabove the atmosphere\u201d.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The atmospheric density\ngradually decreases with altitude, and so often some approximate altitude is\ngiven, such as 30 km.&nbsp; E1 HEMP is the \u201cprompt\ngamma signal\u201d part that lasts out to about a microsecond<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">The E2 element is intermediate in duration,\nlasting from a microsecond to a second after the initiation of the EMP, and is\nsimilar in its effects to lightning.</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp; </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">As\nsuch, the grid is generally shielded against E2.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">By contrast, the E3\npulse is much slower, a result of the nuclear explosion affecting the earth\u2019s\nmagnetic field, and is very similar to the effects of an intense solar\nstorm.&nbsp; The E3 effect of a nuclear blast\nor severe solar storm would be to create massive currents on power lines, which\ncould then destroy electrical transformers and potentially impact power plants\nas well.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">One curious facet of an\nEMP event is that we wouldn\u2019t even feel it pass through our bodies. The EMP\nwould pass unnoticed through us, even as it fried the iPhones and Galaxies in\nour pockets, knocked out our telecommunications system, rendered our cars and\ncomputers without the ability to function, and took out our power grid.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/xOJEb9wE0kM/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/xOJEb9wE0kM?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;rockwell condensed&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 16.0pt; line-height: 200%; mso-bidi-font-family: Aharoni;\">After 21<sup>st</sup> Dec 2012, cosmic rays will shower on earth and\naffect human 97% junk DNA for the better. &nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;rockwell condensed&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 16.0pt; line-height: 200%; mso-bidi-font-family: Aharoni;\">We left the KALI YUGA and entered a cusp period of 30 years , (before\nentry into DWAPARA YUGA ) where we humans have to make FREE CHOICES &nbsp;.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;rockwell condensed&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 16.0pt; line-height: 200%; mso-bidi-font-family: Aharoni;\">We were showered by KALKI &nbsp;gamma\nWAVE &nbsp;X on 28<sup>th</sup> Sept 2015.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;rockwell condensed&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 16.0pt; line-height: 200%; mso-bidi-font-family: Aharoni;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/codenhToRbs/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/codenhToRbs?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A super nuke would\ninject 200,000 volts into the system in a nanosecond.&nbsp; But this can be protected against with a\nscaled-up surge arrestor.&nbsp; They have to\nbe faster than lightning surge arrestors \u2013 those are too slow.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The E1 pulse goes right through before it can\nbe shut down. You need a faster and more robust surge arrestor that would deal\nwith E1 and E3 effects.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/9qwfV3tLL1Q/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/9qwfV3tLL1Q?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b style=\"background-color: yellow;\">OCEANS ELEVEN , CASINO HEIST -- EMP ATTACK&nbsp;</b></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/YS5qgFqZ_S8/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/YS5qgFqZ_S8?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A geomagnetic storm\noccurs when a solar wind interacts with the planet\u2019s magnetosphere and\ntransfers energy to that magnetosphere. This results in increased electric\ncurrent, which can be picked up by power lines essentially acting as antennae.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The famous 1859\nCarrington event reportedly created an aurora borealis bright enough so that\npeople in the northeast could read a newspaper at night.&nbsp; The EMP impact was sufficient to cause\ntelegraph machines to catch on fire and took out the newly laid transatlantic cable.\nIn today\u2019s world, it could have a significantly more devastating effect.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Tehran has revealed it\nhas developed a \u201cfilter\u201d to protect against an electromagnetic pulse attack\ntargeting key national security facilities.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">We can mitigate EMP\ninduced Currents of the E3 component type in an electric power transformer, by\nmeans of a special grounding resistor connected to the neutral end of a\nstar-connected three-phase winding of such apparatus.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Add some fairly small\nand inexpensive resistors in the transformers\u2019 ground connections. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The addition of that\nlittle bit of resistance would significantly reduce the amount of the\ngeomagnetically induced currents that flow into the grid. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The installation of\nsupplemental transformer neutral ground resistors to reduce GIC flows , has low\nengineering trade-offs, and can produce 70 % reductions of GIC levels for\nstorms of all sizes.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When shit hits the fan,\nin the form of a massive EMP and power goes off due to transformer failures ,that\nis NOT the time to run around .&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Blackout trips do NOT happen by sustained heavy\ndrawing-- but but sudden surge. Power grids are more vulnerable than ever due\nto their&nbsp; interconnectedness.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In recent\nyears, utilities have joined grids together to allow long-distance transmission\nof to areas of sudden high demand.It makes good economic sense\u2014but pathetic\ngeomagnetic sense.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Interconnectedness\nmakes the system susceptible to wide-ranging , domino effects and \u201ccascade\nfailures.\u201d&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">I had this STYLE of getting the problem rectified ,\nthen calling the white Engineer concerned to my cabin, closing the door and\nthen giving him a deft Kalari tap on his nose where RED BLOOD gushed out . <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot;
